40622568.review:
One of my favorite underrated games I've played, rampage knights had a lot more to offer than I thought, I've owned this game for very long now and came back to play it long after their latest update with a couple new modes.

I wished more people played this game, I believe it's a great co-op game, admittedly tho, I can look back and understand perhaps it's a bit cruel to new players, it takes quite a while to get used to the flow of the game, and develop new tactics.
With that being said, I still highly recommend it, I gave this game time and felt really satisfied once I finally beat the story mode for the first time.

Many people's issues sometimes can be the RNG in this game, nowhere as cruel as darkest dungeon and other rogue-like games, but it has it's fair share of unnerving moments; you might be rewarded greatly through pure luck, and then instantly punished with no mercy, ending your outstandingly good run. 

I recommend a more casual approach to this game, I felt the harder modes like endless and bombo-rama, were extremely difficult and time consuming, as well extremely punishing, but I didn't find myself going through those until about 40 hours into the game.

Just like any rogue-like, you eventually get a good feel for all the mechanics and possibilities in this game, solo can be greatly fun, but definitely find a friend and play this together for maximum enjoyment.

Perhaps my only real complaint was the music, after hours of playing this game I would find myself mumbling the music in an annoying tone since it really sticks with you.

Try it out

40401020.review:
A very enjoyable, tense but limited experience.

After ignoring this game in my library for a while, I finally managed to do some co-op runs with a friend.

This game shines in coop,  reminding me of the old days of Streets Of Rage and similar experiences.
Finding new items, progressing and overcoming curses/disease are very enjoyable. The multiple characters also add to the replayability and not being put up against the same bosses every run helps as well.
The combat is alright, It's simplistic but it works well for this type of game and it does what it's suppose to do. Being able to hit your friends in coop could be seen as frustrating but due to how easy it is to revive your friend, it's usually more funny than anything else. 

Where this game severely lacks is mostly the graphics department, It looks and plays like a flash game which isn't essentially a bad thing but I think i'd play this a lot more if it was more pleasant to the eyes. 
Another thing I find lacking is the amount of items. There's a reasonable amount but within the 8 hours of playtime I already encountered the same few weapons/items a lot of times.

I can still recommend this game, especially in co-op , but I still enjoy playing it solo when I need to fill that Isaac shaped void in my heart.  At 12 euro, or 9 a piece for the 2-pack, it's a fair price for a simple but very fun game

39475057.review:
一款较硬核的横版卷轴动作清版加Roguelike类游戏。

[h1]游戏剧情[/h1]

《Rampage Knights》很容易让人联想到以前街机平台上的战斧系列，作为一个横版卷轴动作类游戏而言，它的剧情非常简单，一个恶魔巫师[spoiler]（莱恩？）[/spoiler]忽然出现偷走了勇者们归家途中的财宝，而勇者们就此决定向Warlock展开复仇并且重夺财富，于是他们争先恐后地进入了恶魔的城堡。游戏肇始，主角身处一个满是帐篷的营地，周围都是穿着奇装异服的人们。不得不提的是，对于国内玩家而言，《Rampage Knights》的画风多少让人有些头疼。不过毋须担心，游戏的可玩性十足，它会让你忘记一开始的偏见。

[h1]游戏职业、装备、道具[/h1]

游戏可以在初始营地中藉由和NPC对话自定义自己的人物形象，其中包括角色的头发，帽子和性别。也可以更改操控角色的职业，不同职业需要完成不同的成就解锁。而每一个不同的职业都有各自的优缺点，比如以巫师为例，拥有全职业最低的生命值，稍有不慎就会死亡。因为其只有40点生命的关系，基本与游戏中一些强力药水无缘，比如增加巨额力量同时生命上限减半的药水。但是他初始拥有一个会发射火球的小恶魔，小恶魔需要不断补刀才能成长。因此巫师这个职业成长性极高，伴随着高成长同时风险并存，在双人游戏中这种横亘风险又往往可能成为玩家前进的绊脚石。单人模式中选用不同角色进行通关大大丰富了游戏的可玩性，多人模式中也因为角色的相互搭配探索使得每一次新开游戏都充满了乐趣。

角色进入随机地图，装备栏总共包括有武器、腰带、鞋子、圣物以及跟随宠物。《Lost Castle》吸收借鉴了《Rampage Knights》的优点，有大量丰富的武器和圣物。在武器和圣物这一点上，出品时间更早的《Rampage Knights》落了下乘，其武器和圣物数量较为匮乏，而且在单人游戏中，强力武器的选择因为要面对茫茫多的小怪海，所以AOE范围大的武器成为了必然的选择，而游戏中这样的武器数量较少，可惜的是，直到我写的这篇评测时，游戏内容也没有进行太多更新。一把好的武器往往是通关的关键，鞋子是《Rampage Knights》中的一抹亮色，配合不同的鞋子，其可以完成无限空中翻滚，弹簧跳跃（即比一般跳跃要远很多，易于闪避各种攻击的同时破盾将更加麻烦）以及无视地面陷阱等功能。腰带则扮演一个不起眼的小角色，它仅仅作为锦上添花。各异的圣物效果大多是Rouelike类型游戏的常客，这里不一一赘述。《Rampage Knights》中的跟随宠物会让你在通关过程中不再孤单，比如前文所述的巫师最终可以携带三只满级恶魔，比如你也可能会遇到职业海盗自身就已携带的一个神神叨叨的鹦鹉，这个鹦鹉会帮你打击敌人，同时也在一边疯狂奚落和调侃你，当你开锁失败时，它会毫不客气地嘲笑你。除此之外的宠物都仅仅只是跟随在你左右，像是附带的某种定时攻击的BUFF。他们没有自我AI，不会发动主动进攻，某种意义上十分遗憾，但是同时因为不会主动发起进攻，所以高难度下也意味着不会主动吸引来怪物。

游戏的道具栏总共有四项，法术、投掷武器、卷轴、药水。法术道具只能择一使用，强有力的法术是快捷通关的法宝，释放法术需要耗费魔法，魔法随着时间流动而补充，前文所述的巫师拥有全职业最高的初始魔法伤害。一般而言，你大概需要进入第三关才会遇到第一个法术道具。法术道具中比如顷刻瞬移到地图边缘的空间传送或者是连锁闪电等将使得你的通关流程事半功倍，与此相对的，令人沮丧的是，游戏中许多法术就像是鸡肋一般，他们在你释放时无法移动，你很容易成为怪物的靶子。投掷武器作为消耗品能在顷刻间造成巨额伤害，作为各类清版游戏的常见道具这里按下不表。卷轴很有可能会给你带来机遇，也有可能给你带来诅咒。比如说你得到一个祝福，每一个HIT将回复你1HP，但与此同时，你每隔几秒就将损失1HP，你觉得这样的交易是否值得呢？或者卷轴不带有任何负作用，它是个商店免费券，或者是把地上的道具全部随机再生成一次。该作中的卷轴像是老坛酸菜面中附赠的卤蛋一般，虽然看似超值，不过说穿了也就那么回事。而游戏中最亮眼的同时也是后来《Lost Castle》中的核心一环，也就是强有力或者搞怪的药水，不同于《Lost Castle》中的“神农尝百草”，除开神秘效果之外的药水，《Rampage Knights》都会跟你直接阐明药水的使用效果。比如常见的交换力量和血量的药水，比如巨人药水，缩小药水等等，这些也是Roguelike类的常客，略过不谈。有些药水会给你造成一些疾病，同时游戏最高的疯狂难度在你每一次进入新关卡时会随机造成某种疾病。这些搞笑的疾病是这个游戏的最大乐趣之一，比如让你战场中下蛋的变鸡药水，或者让你没病走两步就忽然跳起来的“含笑跳跃颠”，许多怪异的效果在双人游戏中这让我和小伙伴笑得十分开心，私以为这就是游戏的简单的快乐吧。

[h1]游戏操作、难度以及联机模式[/h1]

游戏的操作非常简单，仅仅是攻击、跳跃、闪避、道具选择和使用几个按键。游戏的攻击主要分为普通攻击、特殊攻击、近身投技三种，游戏中有许多持盾怪物，构成了这个游戏最大的通关障碍。只有跳砍和一些特殊攻击才能破盾。值得一提的是，《Rampage Knights》并没有像《Lost Castle》中的升级系统，而且即便是游戏的休闲难度，也仅仅是让你死了之后可以以目前身上的装备从当前关卡重来，因此是一款纯考验操作的硬核游戏。而在困难模式中，则会增加许多小怪。疯狂模式下，进入每个关卡前都将获得某种随机疾病。实际体验中，双人合作模式，我和朋友院长前前后后一直死约花了一个下午的时间最终以野蛮人加冒险者的组合才通关了普通难度。游戏中的宝箱解锁考验玩家的细心，如果不慎失败则会导致掉血。双人合作中友军之间可以互相攻击，尽管不掉血，但是依然会有硬直效果。在成群结队的盾牌海小怪加危险地形加一个喜欢乱攻击的队友，会让你的游戏难度大大增加。如果队友死亡，则需要另一人打一定数量的小怪复活，复活之后将直接回复满血。实际双人通关中，偶尔可以利用先牺牲一人的策略来回复血量。但是如果在这个过程中不慎两人死亡，则在非休闲难度下全部得重新来过，而且按照Rogulike类型游戏的特性，身上所有装备和道具以及拾取的金币全部遗失，这简直就是“看成败，人生豪迈，只不过是从头再来。”私建议新上手的玩家以休闲难度了解游戏以及解锁职业再慢慢提高游戏难度。

《Rampage Knights》有难度，有挑战，同时充满了欢乐。合作模式有本地联机，在线匹配，在线联机三种。在线匹配因为游戏本身小众的关系，所以基本上不可能匹配到人。所以建议在折扣季以双人包的方式入手，快来和你的好友一起成为“暴走骑士”吧。

[spoiler]评分：6/10 7/10（双人联机）[/spoiler]

39357533.review:
For what it is, a beat-em-up style game with rogue-like elements, it has too many problems to make it a recommendation. Just from giving it another shot I ran into very basic problems which shouldn't exist with how long this game has been out:

You can be killed the moment you spawn, enemies are attacking you before you can even react.
It prioritizes the wrong attack actions, like stomps and kicks, when you are surrounded by enemies who hit you repeatedly.
You can be constantly attacked without break, there's no reasonable way to get out of tight situations with small rolls.
You spend the majority of the time running in circles and jumping, not actually fighting and utilizing combos because of the way encounters are stacked against you.
EVERYTHING can become a ranged attacker from all sides, that's just stupid in general.
Only a few of the items are truly strong or unique, most things don't alter gameplay or give you much of an advantage.
Some enemies and attacks are entirely unavoidable and just result in you dieing constantly.

That's just from the last 4 hours with everything unlocked. It's not that you can't enjoy some things in the game, but it's neither pleasent nor stays true to proper beat-em-up action. It's a running away simulator with random jump swings in the mix, not how the game should be and not fun in the end.

39327420.review:
This game initially really frustrated me. That's because it's so god damn fast that's it's completely annoying. Everything attacks as fast as you do, which is like 0.25 seconds. This means that there is no way in hell you will have time to REACT in time when an enemy starts their attack, so you have to rely on certain cheese mechanics:

	• Run around and ensure all enemies are coming at you from straight ahead and then spam the attack button until they all die.
	• Use your magic weapon from far away and then run around so that your MP recharges and then repeat spamming the magic weapon.

Even with this cheese, as time goes on you will make mistakes and eventually die, and that was frustrating as hell for me. Fortunately, I realized that all you had to do was SUPER CHEESE this game. There are multiple classes in this game and the barbarian starts off with a stupidly long range sword. It's slow but very high range. I just used this weapon for most of the game and never got a different weapon despite the low damage. That's because enemies get stunned no matter how much damage they take, so this was beyond a doubt the safest way to reach the end game. Using this strategy, I breezed through the game. There's also some very useful items that'll make the game a lot easier as well (e.g. freeze weapons, extra lives, super speed attack, etc…) so that's nice too.

However, I didn't have much fun with the game due to some poor design decisions:

	• You have "special moves". An upper attack, and lower attack, and a stomp attack. Unfortunately only the lower attack is useful. That's because with the upper attack, you go up in the air and in the air you can't use the "evade" function. Therefore, an enemy will likely run up to you and hit you for damage. The stomp attack is initiated when enemies lie on the ground after a combo. HOWEVER, this stomp attack ONLY damages ONE lying down enemy, NO ONE ELSE. I can't count the number of times where I was spamming the attack button, the character went to do a stomp attack and because of that I got hit from another enemy. This meant that throughout the game, I was only using the normal melee swings and the down attack. This got boring real quick.
	• If you fall into a pit it's an instant death……. O my fucking god this pissed me off so much. Why the hell would you do this in a ROGUE-LIKE. If it was a normal brawler it would be fine since you'll restart in the beginning of the level but in a ROGUE-LIKE, to lose all your progress because of one mistake is infuriating. Imagine if in Binding of Isaac or Enter the Gungeon you instantly got killed for falling into a pit. For fuck sake.
        • In order to open chests, your primary way of getting items, you need to play a mini-game. In this mini-game, if you make a mistake you will GET HURT AND BE SENT FLYING…. Come on man. I was once trying to open a chest, messed up and was sent flying into a put causing me to lose a life. It would've been fine to have a mini-game to change the pace, but for it to DAMAGE you is fucking stupid.

So yea I figured out how to beat the game, but beating the game wasn't all that FUN. I beat hard mode, tried insane mode. I got a disease that makes you constantly run, went into a section which required precise platforming, because I was running I couldn't be precise and fell to my death and game over. Yea…… it's time to move onto better games :P.

39199171.review:
If you like Castle Crashers, you'll probably like this. Get it on a deep discount and maybe you'll get your money's worth. Even then, you'll be better off going into this expecting it to suck - you might possibly end up thinking "it's better than I expected." The largely positive reviews are not a fair representation. It's just not a very good game, not even a good example of its type of game.

I like a lot of silly dumb games, especially local cop-op games that I can play with my wife. I bought this at the same time as Sacred Citadel, for about the same sale price, and SC was well worth it. But Rampage Knights looks like more fun than it actually is, and it would have disappointed me even for free.

The mechanics are kinda meh; movement and hit zones are what you'd expect from a 10-year old browser game, which is pretty much par for the course. It's roguelike in the sense that maps are randomized and there's plenty of cheap deaths that kill your enthusiasm. 

It's got a whimsical style, which is marketing talk for crude cartoon visuals thrown together more or less at random with the excuse of humorous cuteness. There are lots of little graphical perks for people who like hats and moustaches and pets and things like that which add a little spice to a good game (Spelunky, for example) but unneccessarily pad out a cheap one. On the other hand, there are other things that you need to unlock by completing achievments, which is a fine idea... except that it's rewarding repeated meh gameplay with a few more options for more meh gameplay. 

Your real reward is the disk space bonus you get for completing the Uninstalling achievement.

38839029.review:
I find myself playing this more than I probably should.

This is one of those games that lets you get strong through practice, very strong through luck, and then snatch it all away in just a few seconds. You try fighting 5 orcs at once as a chicken and you'll understand.

Why did I buy this game?
It was on sale at the time. I never expected to put so many hours into this with friends, or for my friends to kill me so much.

Is it good?
-You notice an enemy's pattern, react to it, and kick them into the nearest wall.
-Several classes to choose from, with pros and cons to each.
-Simple combat system with a few combos. Easy to pick up, but the difficult decisions about items, weapons, and whether or not to go just one more run bring this game extra replayability.

Some people will get bored with this game very quickly. Others will find a gem. I'd say go for it if you like old school beat'em ups. The variety of things that will go horribly wrong to your character on any particular run might keep you hooked for longer than expected, and when it's on sale it's absolutely worth trying.

Thanks for reading!

This game was a lot of fun; I had an itch for a beat 'em up and it delivered, The combat rewards being aggressive but also discourages being too agressive as theres a defensive element to racking up combos due to the very limitted amount of healing items. Unforgiving at first, but I managed to adapt and understand how each of the bosses and different enemy types. Yeah it takes a bit of trial and error, which can be a bit frustrating to casual players; thankfully there's a mode for the more casual type of player.

The only problem is the final boss of the game. The final boss pretty much throws out everything the game has established to be just to be some sort of bullet hell. Not a good choice IMO.

Other than that, if you wanna bust some baddies (with or without a friend), this games for you.

볼륨이 작은데도 불구하고 적절한 타격감과 도전욕구를 불러일으키는 난이도 덕분에 스팀에서 산 게임 중 가장 오랜 시간을 플레이했습니다.

처음에는 캐쥬얼 난이도에서 간단한 도전과제 달성을 통해 잠겨진 직업들을 해금해야 합니다.

이후 펫 7마리 달기 (펫 공격속도 증가)를 포함해 여러 도전과제를 달성해 캐릭터를 강화합니다.

악마의 저주, 질병, 독 등의 개념이 있고 이를 해제하는 아이템도 따로 있으며, 인벤토리는 마법/원거리무기/스크롤/물약 당 하나씩만 들고다닐 수 있어서 적절한 조합이 필요합니다.

50시간을 플레이한 끝에, 아내와 함께 로컬 협동 모드로 어려움 난이도로 최종보스(2번째 보스)까지 클리어할 수 있었습니다. 성취감이 상당하네요 ㅎ 재미있었습니다.

로컬 협동 플레이로는 워락/어썌신 조합이 괜찮은 것 같네요.

38480712.review:
ローグライクというタグで出てきたことでたどり着きましたが、
ローグライクというよりは、ランダムマップのアクションゲームという内容です
（ローグライトと言うそうです）

他の方のレビューを読めばゲーム内容や面白さは伝わると思うので、
残念な点を書いておきます

・祝福、病気、呪いという状態変化（それぞれ数種類）があるがゲーム内では効果が確認できない
　かかった直後なら最後にかかった効果は表示できますが、基本的にはネットで調べて覚えるしかありません

・ラスボスに関して
　[spoiler]何故かラスボス戦が横スクロールシューティングになります
　ここでやられたことはありませんが、やられた人は納得いかないでしょう
　なぜ最後でこんなことを…[/spoiler]

とまあ、100点満点のゲームではありませんが、相当面白いゲームです
最初は「こんなのクリアできないよー」って思ってても、やっていくうちに慣れます
難易度を上げるとまた「こんなのクリアできないよー」って思いますが、慣れます
最高難易度は「こんなのクリアできないよー」って思いますが、慣れだけでは無理です、運も必要です

最高難易度の実績（フレンドとプレイ）以外はすべて解除してしまったくらいはまりました
値段も安く、おすすめです

注意点として、首をはねる等のグロ描写があります（PV参照）
絵柄がリアルではないのでグロNGな私でも大丈夫でしたが、もしかしたらダメな人もいるかもしれません

38469267.review: I picked this game up to play with my friend and it turned out to be some of the most fun i've had in a while. The co-op is done so well and I love the art style and the combat. 10/10 would do again.

38445081.review:
「ローグライク + ベルトスクロールアクションゲーム」

▪物語
魔女率いる勢力によって王国が占領されてしまった。困った群衆は一人の戦士に魔女を倒すよう申し出た。
それなりに協力はしてくれるようだが残された群衆は数えるほどだ。
道中で手に入るアイテムを活用し何としても生き延びなければならない。
無謀でありながらも限られた環境下で魔女を倒す術を見出せるかは、あなた自身にかかっている。

▪クリア時間
コツを掴めればノーマルで1時間程度。コツを掴むまでに3時間はかかる。

▪ゲーム内容
生き延びられた群衆がキャンプを開いている。

そこでは
「難易度を変更してくれる」手品師。
「キャラクリエイトをしてくれる」散髪や整形技術をもった双子。
「実績の管理をしてくれる」鍛冶屋のおっさん。
「職業を変更してくれる」青年。
「シャドウワールド(最高難易度)を解除してくれる」アルケミスト。
がいる。
またいくつかのモードを選択できるポータル(エンドレスモード等)が管理されている。

ローグライクなので多少の運は勿論のこと、要求されるアクションスキルが高い。
特にダッシュ斬り(Xタメ→スティックを攻撃したい方向へ)とジャンプ斬り、そして回避の使い分けが求められる。
ダッシュ斬りは複数の敵を巻き込み仰け反らせる効果があるので、
複数の敵を巻き込ませた後に接近し「踏みつぶし」や「蹴り飛ばし」を与え、有利な状況へと導いていく必要がある。
なので体の大きな敵もパターンにはめてしまえば恐れることはない。
ただ敵の位置、攻撃態勢などを考慮した上で行動しなければならない。
例としてあげれば、「投げナイフを投げる態勢に入る敵が確認できれば、回避で瞬時にキャンセルに入り次の一手を見計らう」
などがある。戦況を把握し対応できる能力が少なからず必要で、それが得意不得意に繋がるのではないかと感じる。

▪プレイ感想
まず一言、「良作」であるということ。計算された作品で無造作に作り上げられたものではない。
比較的アイテム管理が出来ていれば、どうしようもできない状況に追いやられることが少ない。
初めはコツを掴むことから始まるので、開始3時間あたりは実験的なプレイになるかもしれない。
だがコツを掴めば要領が分かってくるので上達する楽しさが感じられるだろう。
イメージとしては「ローグライクなニンジャガイデン」みたいなもので良いと思う。

▪気になった点としては、「罠が多い(即死もあり)」こと。
宝箱一つ開けるだけでもダメージを受けやすい。慣れても厳しいものがある。
落下すれば即死、終盤に向かうほど事故が多発しやすい。状態異常(毒、呪い等)を受けやすい。
なので結構シビアな状況に追いやられやすい。そこで所持アイテムによって左右されてしまう傾向がある。

▪結論
壊せるものは壊していくことが生き延びるコツです。少しの回復アイテムも逃さぬよう撤退した方が良いです。
良作ではありますが、’人を選ぶ作品’です。個人的には好きな作品だけれど、レビューではお奨めしておりますが友達にはお奨めし難い。

38164836.review:
Just an incredible value of fun. The base game is a simple brawler mixed with basic rogue-like elements where you travel from random rooms fighting a progressively more powerful host of enemies. You start with one no frills class and through a set of challenges unlock new and interesting classes. Each replay feels different enough that even a bad luck run doesn't feel wasted. 

While the game isn't perfect, for me it's pretty much the perfect blend of Castle Crashers and Rogue-Likes.

37810598.review: Всем привет, приобрел данную игру за 69 рублей на распродаже в Steam. Игрой остался доволен. В игре вы повстречаете разную нечесть. Так же в игре есть большой плюс это кооператив (игра с друзьями). Провели в игре около 20 часов. Радует что Rampage Knights даже по сей день обновляют. Добавляют новых (боссов, одежду, оружие и т. д.) Игра хардкорная, конечно кто играл в Super Meat Boy, данную игру не назовут хардкорной, но помучится вам с некоторыми боссами все же придется на уровни сложности от normal, после того как вас убьют, вы начинаете все заново. Уровни всегда разные. Графика в игре своеобразная и мне пришлась по вкусу. По ходу игры, вы можете повстречать торговца и прикупить у него новый меч или другой полезный предмет. Игра за свои деньги просто замечательная, побольше бы таких игр. Советую игру всем :)

36864649.review:
Rampage Knights é um beat'em up com temática medieval bem diferente de tudo que já joguei, com gráficos estilo joguinhos feitos em flash para browsers. Mas não se engane, pois o game oferece grandes desafios aos jogadores, por contar com o estilo roguelike e uma dificuldade bastante elevada nos níveis mais altos. 

Os cenários variam de florestas, castelos e calabouços, sendo gerados aleatoriamente cada vez que se joga. As opções de classes e customizações do personagem são bastante variadas e numerosas, com possibilidades de mudar o estilo de jogo a cada partida. Nem preciso mencionar que isso aumenta consideravelmente o fator replay. Prepare-se para encontrar uma infinidade de armas, poções, magias e ajudantes. Até hoje vez ou outra aparece um item diferente pra mim no jogo.

As conquistas, além de serem achievements da steam, também trazem bônus e facilidades aos jogadores, o que torna obrigatório atingi-las para "facilitar" o término do game.

O jogo possui MP online, mas infelizmente os jogadores que ficam online só jogam na base da sacanagem, atrapalhando mais do que ajudando. No entanto, se vc tiver um amigo pra jogar, é diversão garantida.

36824240.review:
Rampage Knights by Rake in Grass is a cartoon-fantasy throwback to sidescrolling arcade brawlers of old. Its taken a few ideas from other games along the way and dared to try something a bit different; what we ended up with is a game that not only challenges the player, but tempts and taunts them with treasures to risk it all for. Simply put Rampage Knights is the Roguelite RPG equivalent of a beat-em-up. Gone are the rather bland stat placements of some recent ventures into the brawling genre, and in their place the game simply brings a huge variety of weapons, items, magic, afflictions, curses, and characters to play with.

Rampage Knights takes a page out of the old roguelike genre and introduces something of a permadeath mechanic. You do have the opportunity to have multiple lives depending on how you play the game, but once you run out its done, there are no continues, you cant insert another coin and proceed on your merry skeleton-bashing way. Plentiful upgrades and restorative items exist to help mitigate the inevitable damage you'll take along the way, but not everything you find will always be of help to you in your current situation. You may just learn that the shiny new item you got has a few drawbacks and is going to alter how you approach each new situation for awhile.

The difficulty ranges from easy-ish to pretty unfair. Unlockable permanent upgrades like stat boosts will help you along the way and with a bit of effort you can even unlock a few new characters which will change how you play slightly. The game offers plenty of mini achievements to complete during your adventure to achieve these upgrades, from racking up a number of kills or killing monsters in specific ways, to having certain combinations of items, and even to beating the game without dying, if you're skilled enough for the task. The unlockable modes in the game include a wave-based arena, an infinite adventure, a couple of different challenge modes, and even hard and impossible difficulties which really ask you to not only perform your best, but sometimes to also get a little lucky as well.

Rampage Knights is going to kill you over and over again, but thats okay because each game is just a little bit different. The layout of the world tends to be pretty straight forward and linear, but it has a few optional loot rooms, shops, and challenges along the way, and what keeps it fresh and interesting is that most of it changes between each game. Additionally, online and local co-op modes means that you can bring a friend to share in the experience with. And do not fear if you die, your less-dead companion can always bring you back by performing well, collecting souls, and sending some of those demons back to hell. Whats more is that while you're having an out-of-body experience your ghost can even help out in some small ways as well, from scouting ahead to knocking down enemies to even breaking destructible items and setting off some traps.

At the end of the day if you're even a mild fan of some of the old 90's arcade brawlers you're almost certain to enjoy Rampage Knights, its got the variety and challenge to keep you coming back to find new items, complete the mini-achievements and unlock new modes, upgrades, and characters, and get further along than you did in your previous game by learning from your mistakes. Its just different enough each time that you don't feel like you're doing the exact same thing over and over again, and its a very easy game to just pick up and play when you've got a bit of time to kill. Rake in Grass hit it out of the park with this excellent indie game.

The Good:
- Secrets to uncover.
- Fair but difficult challenge.
- Local and online multiplayer.
- Risk versus reward gameplay.
- Lots of items, weapons, and magic to discover.
- Randomization of levels, enemy encounters, and powerups.
- Permanent upgrades / characters / modes / difficulties to unlock.

The Bad:
- You can only see what the last item you picked up does.
- Randomization means that some runs may come down to luck.
- The character and mode unlocks might not be paced for everyone.
- Breaking objects on the level to earn gold / health can slow the pacing.
- Friendly fire: Not everyone will like that your attacks can interrupt your partner.
- Permanent upgrades can create a bit of a player/skill gap in multiplayer with newbies.

36654574.review:
Honestly, when I first saw this game I thought it would just be your generic beat 'em up game like double dragon. It is so much more interesting than that. It has such a large variety of items and enemies that the game never feels old and I always want to start it up after losing a run. There is great syndergy with items that create insane combos with magic or straight up melee attacking. The game also teaches that skill and patience will take you far. You can easilly kill every enemy in the room without taking a hit if you are careful and know patterns. Even the ogres aren't bad after you realize you just hit and dodge roll or move after they roar. Or you could run around the room and use magic when your bar fills up. Or a great combo is using the lazer eye with the items that gives a lot of mana on kill. It is great. It is a fun and difficult game that is just so good.

Another interesting thing is that achievements actually give you permanent buffs in this game. It is great. It's a new incentive to actually go for tough achievements and it unlocks the other classes. Particularly the Warlock is kind of too good, but so is the battlemage if you have patience. Every class has a weakness and strength. 

The best part is that this game has online co-op. Simple and fun co-op. Host a match and invite over steam just like that. DONE. It is so simple. Or you can even play local.

Overall, amazing game, pick it up. Even playing alone is fun

36583277.review:
For the price of admission imho this game doesn't offer much.

You get to choose from 6 different classes (Adventurer, Barbarian, Pirate, Assassin, Warlock and Battle Mage), which are all suitable different: The Barbarian can't wear armor and is slow but tough, the pirate uses a cannon, the assassin can vanish, the battle mage uses spells instead of dodging, etc. This is all kinda nice. Unfortunately you have to unlock all the classes first. Now, granted, this is relatively easy, since you unlock casual mode, where you can simply restart a level, pretty early on (by just dying 3 times), but there's 1 achievement I still couldn't get to unlock the Warlock, because I never get fucking cursed or find a curse removal item. Because yes, this is a rogue-lite/like. After unlocking the characters there's not really any more progression. You do not get stronger after runs. You start just like that from the beginning.

Going through the various levels takes about 1 1/2 hours to see the final boss...and then it's just rinse repeat with some random elements like traps, enemies and items of course. Since I've seen the same few weapons drop in the first 5 levels in pretty much every run, as well as the same items, I don't think there's too much variety here. Later on there are a few more, but it's no Isaac or anything like that. Items are armor, weapons, potions, scrolls, throwables and a kind of artifact you can find. Then there's various poisons, diseases and curses in the game as well. And you can definitely kill any chance of completing a run by picking up or using the wrong items. So far so semi-fun.

Where the game falls apart imho is in the combat itself. It's slow, sluggish and very punishing. You think you hit an enemy but you're 1 mm short or the enemy swings a nanosecond earlier and you take damage. Damage you can't heal, unless you find healing potions. And you can die very fast to many of the enemies in the game, especially the giants. Evading, attacking, it's all not terrible, but not great either. However, in the later stages combat becomes terribly difficult to manage imho, because the game throws a lot of enemies on you and by that time you will also have some "familiars", little creatures that accompany you. On my first successful run I had like 6 or so floating around me, all doing their own little effects. Needless to say I killed stuff incredibly quickly, but I also didn't see my screen much in combat. I got this for like 3 bucks and I'm ok with that. It was fun for like 3 to 4 hours and now I'm done with it, since I'm not really interested in the other classes anymore after testing them out a bit. I only really liked the Barbarian and perhaps the Assassin. The battle mage cannot dodge, so he's a no go, despite having nice spells, the pirate can't do a charged attack, which is incredibly important to knock down groups of enemies imho, instead he gets a reloadable cannon that does no damage and only a little pushback...and like I said I haven't unlocked the Warlock, though he does sound interesting. Nice concept, terrible graphics, mediocre execution. Wait for deep sale imho.

35951287.review: So this a relatively charming little beat-em-up game.  The mechanics are decent, and tend to rely on you rolling frequently to evade and stunlocking to murder enemies into comedic explosions of limbs.  You also find magical upgrades to help with the increasingly difficult enemy groups, and in particular you can run a chain of multiple little familiars behind you.  This means you can end up with a tiny Guy Fawkes head throwing bombs, a demon eye shooting lasers, a crystal zapping electricity, and a demon shooting fireballs all at once.  There isn't a huge variety in the gameplay overall but a session is relatively short, and as something to run through for an hour or two here and there it's entertaining.

35486292.review:
A decent beat em' up roguelike that accomplishes what it sets out to do. Difficult at first, but once you get down the patterns and item abilities, it becomes fairly manageable.

Admittedly, I don't think the side scrolling fighter aspect pairs very well with the roguelike elements, or perhaps it has more to do with how it was executed. Most weapon wielding enemy types have almost zero windup on some of their standard attacks, whereas you have a second delay most of the time. This produces scenarios where you'll get hit by an enemy, despite the fact you almost cannot predict their attack. To make matters worse, enemies that are lying on the ground can occasionally pop back up and hit you within seconds flat. The AI makes predicting attacks even more dubious, as they will sometimes not attack at all or fall back for no apparent reason.

Once you settle into the game's mechanics though, it becomes a decent veg out game. You can just boot it up and turn your brain off an play. Even better, the game saves between each area, and you can hop out at any time. Runs are usually 45 minutes to an hour long, but can be split up between sessions of 15 minutes a piece if need be. Their system is robust enough that I even had a bluescreen while playing(unrelated to the game), and was still able to continue where I left off with no penalty.

[b]Now that I've given this game a fair shake, this is where I get to the reason I felt compelled to review the game.[/b]

Basically, I can't recommend this game on the grounds that it breaks a cardinal rule of game design. Don't require challenges that don't reinforce the core elements of your game's genre. You'll play for an hour to get to the final boss. You finally find a strategy and set of items that works and defeat him, only to be insulted with a post boss mini-game that is completely alien to everything the game represents. A bullet hell shooter that throws your items out the window.

How... How on earth did this idea even get considered. Many have warned it in the reviews, but I simply have to reiterate how bad this is design-wise. A non-optional fight that uses a different control scheme and does not take into account any of the skills or items you had previously used. It makes me angry every time I get to the end. I've managed this sequence a few times, with some close calls, but I can't imagine having players who can't manage a bullet hell get destroyed by what is basically a middle finger to the player. Imagine playing Binding of Isaac only to get to the end, and it turns into a Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles arcade beat em up for the final boss, and none of your items count. Imagine Left 4 Dead's finales requiring you to play Bubble Bobble to escape. Imagine playing Dark Souls, and the boss in Anor Londo is a few rounds of BurgerTime.

The fix is simple, cut the shooter out or make it an optional side gag. The fact that it's mandatory is juvenile and insulting. Until then, it's not recommended.

34557569.review:
只想给个中评的，但是只能选推荐或不推荐，那么最好选推荐了，建议折扣比较大的时候出手。
画面一般，音乐一般，音效还不错，剧情基本没有。系统是ACT清版过关类，通过在游戏过程中完成挑战（也就是成就）来解锁新人物以及各种全局增益。除了最后boss之外，地图、怪物和掉落物品都是随机的。
总的来说，游戏中期比较好玩。前期是一穷二白，基本每次也就达到第二关。只能靠慢慢积累数据和熟悉手感来提高水平。中期解锁一些新人物并且获得一些道具组合之后，能够玩得很开心。但是到了后期，提升能力的挑战基本都做完了，剩下就是不断反复尝试某些模式（困难难度、竞技场、无尽地牢等等），如果不是技术特别好的话总是过不去容易产生挫败和单调的感觉。
不同的人物其实差别不大，大多数不仅特色不鲜明，反而用起来更困难。
道具种类太少，大概20小时就基本全都见到了，而且里面有很多都是完全没用的、搞笑的或弊大于利的。
游戏系统上有些设定比较像成心刁难玩家，比如：玩家攻击前后硬直都很大，敌人小兵基本人手无限飞刀（那还区分什么远程兵和近战兵……），敌人会出现随机的二连击、三连击，巨人不仅攻高血厚出手速度还快，竞技场倒数第二轮奖励的坑爹的神秘药水，总之高难度下会有各种各样恶心的死法。
多人游戏网络大部分时间还不错，偶尔抽风。然而难度并没有降低，趣味性增长也有限。
所以对自己动作游戏的水平没有信心的玩家建议远离这款游戏。
在对数值平衡性和难度性的掌握上，我觉得《失落城堡》青出于蓝。

This game is a hidden gem between all the roguelike games. Its sheer randomness makes it extremely difficult from time to time but definitely doesn't make it less fun.

You can choose from alot of different modes and classes. Those are unlocked through progress based achievements. Hence the more difficult characters are more difficult to obtain.

The INSANE difficulty is where the game shines the most. As I said , the biggest strength of the game is its randomness and the insane mode just makes the game unbelievably unpredictable and fun.

REPLAYABILTY (!!!) - no run is similar to the previous one.

A fair bit of character customization is present aswell.

You would be a fool for not trying this one with your buddy for the price of the 2-pack !
I cannot do otherwise but recommend this hidden gem for you. I had alot of fun playing it and will definitely pay a visit regularly.

This is an incredibly frustrating game. Unclear / unresponsive controls. You cannot initiate a new move before the other has finished. Sometimes moves work, sometimes they don't. Took me forever to figure out why my jump-slash wasn't working; it's because-- like a normal gamer-- I was still holding the jump key down when I initiated the attack. 

That's right-- the game doesn't let you hold down more than one key at a time without getting confused. So if you are halfway through executing an attack and realize it's not going to work, don't bother trying to dodge-- you have to wait for the animation to finish and the enemy is done pummeling you before you can do anything else.

As with most rogue-likes, it's all about rolling broken loot that will carry you through to the end with little to no skill.

32303789.review:
Oyun son dönemde gördüğüm en göründüğü gibi olmayan oyun diyebilirim. Nedenine gelince bakıyorsunuz oyunun gameplaylerine sanıyorsunuz çizgi film tadında eğlencelik bir yapım ama oyunu girdiğinizde hiç de öyle olmadığını görüyorsunuz. Karakterler ve etkileşime girdikleri her şey çok komik ama oynanış ve size yaptığı işkence de çok komik. Bir kere oyunda save ya da adam gibi bir checkpoint sistemi yok. Öldüğünüz anda en baştan başlıyorsunuz bulunduğunuz bölüme. Ayrıca bölümü geçmek deveye kanyon atlatmaktan beter. Co-Op oynadığınızda bu işkence ikiye katlanıyor. Çünkü ne kadar çok oyuncu varsa oyun o kadar zorlaşıyor. Ayrıca oyunu Casual modda oynuyor olup olmamanız hiç önemli değil çünkü oyun böylesine bir içeriğe sahip oyuna göre çok zor. Eğlencesinin tümünü götüren bu zorluk sizi yaptığınız her hatada cezalandırıp başa atıyor buda bir yerden sonra kabak tadı vermesine neden oluyor. Kısacası oyunu gameplaylerine bakarak bir karara varmaya çalışan arkadaşlar dikkatli olsun derim. Fiyatı çok yüksek olmamasına rağmen oynanabilirliği görsellerine göre çok geride. Elindeki potansiyeli çok feci sekilde oyuncuyu sıkarak harcayan yapım çok kısa zamanda kenara kaldırıp bir daha yüzüne bakmayacağınız bir yapıda.

+ Eğlencesinin tüm kaynağı absürdlüğünden ve görselliğinden dolayı.
+ Renkli, cıvıl cıvıl, içerik olarak dolu dolu haritalar.
+ Az da olsa oyunda karakter özelleştirme ve yükseltme.
+Düşük boyut ve düşük boyut.

- Oyun gereksiz derecede zor ve bu durum oyunun eğlencesinin tümünü alıp götürüyor.
- Kontrollerdeki saçmalıklar ve eksiklikler.
- Co-Op modunun sadece 2 kişiye kadar destek vermesi.

优点就不说了，这么多的好评已经可以说明问题了。
我只想说关于暴虐骑士的几个问题。

[olist]
[*] 浑水（murky water）、屁股药水（a-s-s potion）、神秘药水（mysterious potion）真的没什么用（useless），平时也不会去吃，连捡都不会捡。[spoiler]中了大脚符咒把鞋子弄没了的感受你懂得[/spoiler]

[*] 这游戏想通关其实很简单，尽量不要吃脏药（dirty medicine），所有的诅咒和黑药水不要吃（don't drink or interaction），比如大维齐的恐怖转换药水（grand vizier’s terrifying transmutator）、红色的诅咒雕像（demon statue），就连玩纸牌的红色恶魔（demon trader）也不要点，所有怪物和boss的攻击都有规律可循，这游戏容错率很高，只要躲好，就通关了。

[*] 奇怪的是，如果武器没有特效，那么无属性的武器基本上都比有属性的武器好，因为有属性的武器的伤害是一半为白字伤害，一半为属性伤害，但是有的怪可能免疫某属性伤害。

[*] 让我更奇怪的是，很多职业特点和缺点太鲜明，导致还不如用冒险家（adventurer），虽然比较中庸，但是比较稳定。其他职业比如野蛮人（barbarian）居然不能穿衣服防具，移动速度-15%，血量加的那点还不够打一下的。

[*] 道具还是太少了，太少了，太少了，听说这个团队在开新坑，但愿不会落下暴虐骑士的更新。
[/olist]

31493612.review:
[h1]Un roguelike degno di nota![/h1]
Dopo averlo completato al [b]100%[/b], posso dire che vale il suo prezzo.

Nella sua semplicità riesce a stupire. Il gioco genera dungeon con stanze sempre diverse, ognuna con mostri e nemici differenti; ciò si traduce in [b]"alta rigiocabilità"[/b]. Offre inoltre una varietà di armi, corazze, pozioni e molto altro che rendono ogni partita avvincente.

Consiglio il [b]2-Pack[/b] se si ha un amico con cui giocare. Ovviamente in cooperativa il divertimento raddoppia; in più andando avanti nel gioco si sbloccano modalità alternative e oggetti per la personalizzazione del personaggio.

Come se non bastasse si può giocare anche in Coop Locale.

[b][i]Rampage Knights assicura ore di divertimento e risate, soprattutto se giocato con un amico, magari anche comunicando con la chat vocale.[/i][/b]

31475982.review:
This is another one of those games that look much worse than they are fun.
Even when a friend of mine recommended it to me, I was worried it might be trash.
As you might have guessed, it's not.

Rampage Knights is an "Isaac-like" brawler with a heavy emphasis on melee combat.
The dungeon is randomized every run and you can even bring a friend and play together online (and on equal terms with none of that half-baked "supporter" crap other games tend to do).
You can unlock higher difficulties, additional game modes, and a ton of achievements.
The latter aren't just for show though, as they do unlock new classes, characters, hats, and even permanent boosts, making them worth the time and effort required to unlock (most) of them.

Combat is fast paced and varied enough to keep you engaged for many hours.
You charge, dash, jump, dodge-roll, kick and stomp the crap out of ugly-looking monsters at delicious 60fps.
Be warned though, because the game has a tendency to screw you over in ways that are just blatantly unfair.
There were times when my character was knocked down right next to a bomb, causing me to get hit when I got up.
Another time the game made me respawn right on top of a set of spikes, and with no invincibility whatsoever, causing me to get hit (a friend of mine even respawned on top of a hole, killing her instantly). Some treasure chests are deliberately placed next to pits, dropping you to your death if you happen to fail the unlocking minigame.
It's moments like these that create hilarious situations in multiplayer, but in solo play they feel like a kick in the groin.

Speaking of multiplayer, I highly recommend playing it with a friend.
Just keep in mind that there is friendly fire, and while you don't take damage from each other's attacks (bombs excluded), you can still knock the other player into a pit, some spikes, or an explosion. Make sure to use voice chat so you can yell at each other properly.

If 12€ is too much for you, put it on your wishlist and get it when it goes on sale.

難易度の調整が絶妙で、ついつい何度もやってしまうローグライク・アクション。
アイテムが文句なしに揃うことはないと云っていいが、それだけにその中でやりくりしてクリアできたときの達成感はひとしお。

慣れるまでは非常に難しいが、我慢してやってほしい。

31331065.review:
This game is fun, but it needs more options to configure and customize the instances. It would be great to be able to apply different settings to a game instance (e.g. a "custom game" that allows you to pick enemy types, drop types, chest types, etc.) and it sorely needs an option to DISABLE FRIENDLY FIRE. For what is kind of supposed to be a friendly "couch game" it is incredibly annoying (after it stops being funny the first few times) to constantly hit your friend down holes or knock them down as they are trying to escape a hit. How this simple option eluded being implemented is beyond me. It also wouldn't hurt expanding supported players up to 4. I realize that requires rebalancing, but this is not a competitive game that should require a lot of balancing thought - maybe just bump up the amount of monsters and spawns? I don't know, I'm sure the smart people who designed the game can facilitate that.

My final takeaway (TL;DR): A good game to play casually with friends and hack and slash your way through levels, but it can be refined. I would tell the developers to have some more fun with the game and don't try and make it such a try-hard game like Isaac.

- Add options to mess with the game instances
- Add the option to REMOVE FRIENDLY FIRE
- Potentially up the supported players to 4.

Regardless, a decent game in it's current state - hope to see it get better so I can justify playing some more.

Easy to learn, hard to master, full of variety. This side-scrolling beat-em-up action-rpg mashup removes the "junk sorting" that plagues most ARPGs and instead focuses on fun combat. It's amazing how much strategy and variety there is to a combat system that employs a single 'attack' button and 4 item slots. Also expect some platforming, watch out for those chasms! Good for throwing your enemies down, but when you and a friend are brawling it out with a goblin gang, be careful not to chuck a corpse into your buddy, sending them screaming into the great abyss.

Every run delivers a new twist. This game is a very pleasant surprise! Online and couch two-player co-op slathers the icing on this tasty cake.

31114244.review:
Im in love with this game.
Ok so first of all before i start this review just a real quick disclaimer, do not pay attension to my hours on steam, iv played atleast 12+ more hours offline and i thought i should clear that out of the way first.

So first thing first Rampage Knights is the best indie game i have played in the last 2 years. It combines all the elements i find essential in a video game and i will now list all the pros and cons so that you can see what it does right and what wrong.

Pros:
+Randomally generated dungeons
+Tons of replay value
+Customizable characters
+Really neat art style
+Local and online coop
+Great controls
+Dosen't feel repetitive
+Good length (even after you complete the main game you still have plenty and i mean PLENTY of things to come back for.)
+Veriaty of weapons, abilities, potions, and scrolls
+Humorous at times
I dont have many cons for  this game, but i will still try and list some.

Cons:
-Game can be unfair at times (you might get so powerful with all possible gear and powers, and then just in a brief second you dont pay attension and fall down to a pit leading to your death.)
-The game is not rewarding enough (after you finish a run, all your gear resets and you dont really feel like you accomplished anything which is frustrating.)
-You need to unlock achievments in order to play certain game modes (and i know some people may find it fun but i just think it's really annoying cause some achievments are really hard to unlock.)

So overall Rampage Knights is a very solid game, with elements suitable for both casual and hardcore gamers and a smooth gameplay that will keep you at the edge of your seat at times.

Rating: 9.5/10


Edit: i got this copy from my friend who bought two copies for me and for him real cheap.

This game is baasically just a bad version of Castle Crashers with none of the polish or control finesse mashed together with the loot system in Binding of Issac. It's miserable to play, since the one-button combat manages to feel overworked and yet also completely unrefined.

31017725.review:
I'll be honest, to me, the game is very ugly and unapealing to look at (even worse on a big tv screen). At times it looks like a simple flash game and at others just awkward and a poor style choice. I've seen this compared to Castle Crashers and really, it's pretty far from it. The action isn't with tight controls as Castle Crashers was. Depth perception is sometimes an issue as you might not be entirely sure what is something you can walk on or how far (And holy hell do they use this against you by constantly putting put falls everywhere). Controls are useable but far from great. It doesn't feel smooth and you can very easily lose track of where you are and what you're doing in the mist of a cluster of mobs wanting you dead. I hate the heavy attack "Dash Attack" as often I don't have a moment to even use it due to trying NOT to get killed instantly. And quite frankly there are so many unused button options that they could've added two attack types and make combos from them. The lack of "no-friendly fire" option is insanely annoying. It's easy to hit co-op mates, get them killed or mistakenly stopping your co-op partner from killing an enemy. I could really do without that. For the first few times of playing I felt like the Ghost was useless/terrible and that it didn't make sense for it to even be able to do friendly fire damage as well as the amount of required souls was far too much. After a while you get used to how crap it is and attempt to use it to your advantage.

I will admit that the only thing keeping this game interesting and keeping me from disliking/not recommending it is the items. All these random added effects can make for an easier time or unique styles of play. I'm sure it's basically stolen from the Isaac games but it really does well here. The only annoying thing about them is that I don't know what is "stackable" upon pick up and what would replace another without trying it first. I would also prefer if I was told about "mana" and how mana things worked. Still, we ended up figuring it out and how useful/useless it could be.

I do hope they make a second one with 4 player co-op madness and really improve the controls and visuals.

I got this for a few bucks and for co-op. It's MSRP is CDN $12.99 and I don't personally think it's worth that much. But at half price or so, sure.

While I like the idea of Rampage Knights, it got repetitive, fast!

Basically you start in the camp having two lives, you choose your class, your appearance and whatever you unlocked, you go to your adventure in areas that are randomly generated, and when you die, you lose everything, your gold, your equipment, your hero and everything, and you start over again, now if you’re like me that dies a lot in video games it’s going to be one hell of a loop, yes eventually you get better but you will repeat the same areas a lot.

I like the graphics, the music is just okay, I like the many many perks, diseases, curses, and a lot of unique stuff, sometimes you end up having a unique and interesting builds, and sometimes you end up being a joke.

Sometimes this game feels unfair, sometimes you don’t pay attention to a hole because you’re confused with the graphics, and there you go, you lost one life in the center of your face, sometimes three of more giants will gang up on you and you will end up being gangbanged, and not in a good way.

I spent around 6 hours playing this game, I recommend it, but I suggest if there’s some kind of progression system besides the challenges list, it’s a loopy 7 out of 10.

30895742.review:
EDIT: I corrected a few inaccuracies about the controls and added info about character classes, and cleaned up some of the explanations. I hope. Corrections are welcome in the comments.

This is a Rogue-lite beat-'em-up with online multiplayer. Wait, what? "Rogue-likes" are games that where you navigate a procedurally generated (that is, randomized each time) dungeon without saving, each attempt starts from scratch. A "Rogue-*lite*" game like this lets you unlock better starting abilities based on progress from your previous attempts. 

You're an adventurer returning from a successful dungeon raid, when an evil wizard steals all your loot. Time to march to the wizard's tower and have a word with him about that. You'll just have to use whatever you pick up along the way.

I started with the keyboard, but ended up buying a gamepad, since a fighting game just doesn't feel right to me otherwise. The left analog stick is used for movement, X is attack, A is jump, Y to activate things and grab items, B to use items, LB and RB cycle through inventory slots, LT and RT are for dodge-rolling. It was very responsive and worked fine for me. You can use the direction pad for inventory, dropping items, and emotes, but you only need drop and emote in multiplayer.

It plays a lot like side-scrolling beat-'em-ups like Golden Axe or Final Fight. You can move in any direction, but only attack left and right, except for things like magic and some special attacks. There's a life bar that you replenish by eating food or chugging healing potions, and a magic bar that restores itself over time. You only start with one extra life.

Your inventory has a spell slot, a throwing weapon slot, a scroll slot, and potion slot. You can only carry one of each, so use them instead of hoard them. You can carry plenty of throwing weapons but they have to be all the same type.

Most spells have a big magic cost to start, but a slow magic drain as you continue them, so it's better to hit a group with a long blast of magic than to use it sparingly. There are lightning bolts, fireballs that set the enemy ablaze for damage over time, ice storms that freeze them in place, and more oddball stuff like a "Dwarven Contraption" with many uses, from crushing enemies to cracking locked treasure chests.

Throwing weapons are pretty important to your survival. You can chuck a simple stone at your enemy to stun them, fling throwing daggers, knock down a row of them with a throwing axe, or lob Zelda-style cherry bombs at them.

Scrolls are single-use magic spells. There's a wide variety of these. Some grant powers, some remove curses, some freeze monsters in the room, etc. There's even one that instantly builds a floor over all the bottomless pits in the room.

The potions are mostly healing or powerups. There are some that give a huge amount of healing but also give you a random disease. Of course, there are also potions to remove curses and diseases, and some to increase your strength.

The main challenge of the game is collecting a combination of abilities that works well from what you have available. Many of the sources of powerups (like the demon's card-guessing game) can give you random curses and diseases. Some powerups have inconvenient drawbacks, but then some curses and diseases actually have useful side-effects! A classic example is the Mighty Foot, which tries to stomp you every few seconds, but can also stomp enemies near you. There's also a mechanical arm which lets you do constant spinning attacks, but you can't use the dash attack anymore.

There are lots of weapons, armor, and other gear available along the way. Some you get from chests (solve a simple lockpicking minigame) or you can find shops to buy them with gold pieces. You can also pick up familiars who follow you around and zap your enemies or help you in various ways. Altars give you random powers, but some are cursed or have other costs.

Combat is quick and frantic, with lots of enemy variety, hordes of minions, nasty little fliers, and fearsome giant bosses. There are different special attacks you can perform depending on which direction you're moving when you attack, a stomp for prone or crawling enemies, and jump and dash attacks. Some enemies use shields which can only be broken by jump attacks or dashes, or by weapons with the shieldbreaker ability. The dodge-roll helps when fighting giants, because they get temporary stagger resistance after they get staggered; knocking them into bottomless pits is sometimes an option. Kick enemies across the room, toss them into the air, and spin them around to hit other enemies! The game gives you lots of ways to handle large groups.

Critical hits (a slim chance that any hit does lots of extra damage) are a thing, and some magic weapons have extra effects on criticals. Status effects like getting frozen, set on fire, poisoned, etc. are also a thing, but there are ways to become immune most status and damage types.

There's quite a bit of platforming, that is, jumping over pits and spikes. Most of it is tough but fair. Fortunately there are also jump boots, levitation scrolls, flying carpets, and the like which can be useful there. A double jump can be unlocked in various ways, and this is very handy for both combat and platforming, but it needs to be unlocked again every run unless you're an Assassin.

Losing all your lives (or finishing the game by reaching the castle and killing the evil wizard) sends you back to the beginning to start all over again. There are "challenges" that track your lifetime stats over multiple runs, which unlock new abilities and character classes. For example, breaking 200 shields makes your shield-breaking create a shockwave that damages everything nearby, inflicting 100,000 spell damage gives you a spell damage bonus, and opening 200 locked chests makes lockpicking much easier by making the lockpick minigame shorter. Some challenges also unlock new hats for your character, and many different player skins are available from the start.

Aside from the starting Adventurer character class, there are unlockable classes. Some of them change the game in significant ways: The Pirate uses a cannon instead of a dash attack, the Assassin can become invisible briefly instead of dodge-rolling, the Battlemage can teleport, etc.

I didn't play any multiplayer yet, so I can't really review that part. It's two-player only, with an online server browser.

The sprite art style and funky music give the game a fun arcade feel, and there's lots of bizarre humor in the game. There are some cute shout-outs to other indie games: The "Serious Bomberman" powerup gives you a Serious Bomb for a head, and the "Fish Warrior Lady" player skin might look familiar to Undertale players.

Overall I was very happy with this purchase. I'm not that much into Rogue-like games, but it was a nice change of pace.

30525689.review:
还在犹豫的朋友们，可以买了，这个游戏个人十分推荐，某宝上可以以双人包的价格入。把各角色的hard都通了一下之后，感觉这个游戏的可玩性还是比较丰富的，不仅仅有高难度的剧情模式，还有一些其他模式像无尽模式，暗影世界等等。难度是这个游戏一个吸引人不断玩下去的点，刚开始玩的时候，最简单的难度都一直死，然后达到第三个场景好像是dark castle时，不知道是死了多少次死过去的，整个人很抑郁，满脑子就是：TMD这XX游戏怎么那么难，心里玩的比较烦，不过稍微花点时间和耐心玩一下之后就感觉到其中乐趣了，刚开始初始的键位也特别不适应（虽然我也没找到让我感觉最合适的键位，干脆就用手柄玩了）。后来玩的多了之后好不容易一通了一次关，渐渐的开始玩normal，到玩hard，不得不提熟练的使用翻滚非常重要，想想一开始的时候从来不用翻滚就是一阵乱砍，死的贼快。后来送了几个朋友这个游戏，一起玩也挺激情的。这里顺便推荐一下很棒的道具好了，帮助没玩几次的朋友。
神器：机械手，装备了之后变成大风车涡轮究极宇宙豪华皇家无敌旋风斩，不停的造怪物硬直，同时注意走位，就算攻击慢速的武器旋转频率还是很快，拿到就等于一只脚迈进通关大门。
魔法道具：冰球，这个道具还是挺屌的，好几次一滴血就靠冰球的远距离减速冰冻翻盘，而且有时候拿到一些好的火属性的武器时，打恶魔系的怪贼难打，这时候有个冰球直接打恶魔双倍伤害加控制，唰唰的就干掉。
自由给予者：美帝的一个老鹰，拿上后开启轰炸机模式，还是挺好用的，在空中的同时躲避伤害，算准连环炸弹还能对一个巨人造成很高的伤害，有的都是刺或者不好跳的地方直接飞过去也非常安全。
投掷武器：如果匕首多的话建议攒匕首，千钧一发时一串匕首秒个巨人或者boss，还是不错的。
武器：（骷髅不死系怕火不怕毒，恶魔系怕冰不怕火）一般不推荐有属性的武器，除非有道具能克制这些属性怪。不然的话抵掉一半伤害还是很费劲的。
还有一些搭配像野蛮人血多的，拿上一个看起来是油漆桶的道具，减一半血上限造成两倍伤害的，刷起怪来也是瞬间的事情，之前刷上油漆桶，拿起对不死系2倍伤害的武器，刀刀200，暴击300多，菜刀切豆腐的感觉不要太美。
暂时想不到了。。。反正好玩，努力先挑战一下insane

30392988.review:
[h1]Хуліганське фентезі[/h1]

Мало хто ніколи не чув про жанр фентезі: «Володар перстнів», «Відьмак», всесвіт Dungeon and Dragons і купа інших відомих тайтлів розрахованих на будь-який смак і вік. Зазвичай представники цього напряму містять всього потроху, напираючи в основному на драматизм і пафос. Але що вийде в результаті, коли за розробку візьметься студія, яка подарувала світу пародію на всі фантастичні штампи у вигляді Jets’n’Guns? Відповідь: Rampage Knights.

Перше творіння студії Rake in Grass було класною грою: поступова еволюція кораблю від бляшанки до машини геноциду, класні приколи в описі зброї, динамічний геймплей, веселий сюжет сповнений штампів, купа різних рівнів і, звичайно, забійний саундтрек. Що ж лишилось з того букету? RK – типовий представник жанру roguelike: рівні генеруються автоматично, шмот і покращення персонажа з’являються випадковим чином, смерть на нормальній і вище складності відправляє нас на початок. 

Ігровий процес став набагато глибшим: прокляття і хвороби, покращення персонажа, магія, різноманітна броня і зброя, купа різних пробірок з найрізноманітнішим вмістом і величезна кількість засобів перевірити параметри удачі гравця. Знайти це все добро можна під час проходження рівнів. Пара слів про них: ми стартуємо з табору, проходимо ліс і опиняємось в замку головного гада. Але перед тим як схрестити зброю в двобої з ним, доведеться подолати всі кімнати, представлені на рівнях. В кінці кожного етапу нас буде очікувати один з босів, який як слід потріпає нерви, особливо на складності hard і вище.

Для подолання ворогів треба не тільки мати непогану екіпіровку, а й прямі руки: на затиранні до блиску самої клавіші удару далеко не заїдеш. У справі розправи з ворогами нам у нагоді стануть рятівні перекати, спецприйоми і комбо система, яка працює за правилом більше лупиш – далі будеш. Випадкове випадання речей і покращень не дає змайструвати убер героя, який тільки одним поглядом стиратиме босів на порох.

Варто пару слів сказати і про ворогів. Бестіарій більш менш конвенційний: демони, розбійники, орки та інші стандартні представники жанру фентезі. Доставляє також і механіка двобою: ворога зі щитом не візьмеш простою атакою, треба розбити щит або повалити його на землю і потім докопати ногою; є живі мерці, які перероджуються, якщо не розчавити голову, що лишається на місці після смерті тощо. Наявні і просто здоровезні огри і інші дуболоми, від яких хочеш не хочеш, а мусиш увертатись. Більш того, якщо ворог лежить на землі, то можна його взяти… і викинути в провалля, якщо воно наявне. Шик.

Гріхом буде не згадати про одну з найбільших родзинок гри: тони упоротого, подекуди наркоманського, гумору-чорнухи. Ви колись бачили персонажа з дупою замість голови, вухами віслюка і в масці а-ля Зорро? Ласкаво просимо! Компаньйон у вигляді повної бабищі в шкірі з батогом? На здоров’я! Після такої психоделії, магія під назвою Freedom Giver, використовуючи яку персонаж підлітає в повітря і в буквальному сенсі цього слова починає срати бомбами, сприймається як щось буденне. 

Вишенькою на цьому торті абсурду є кооперативний режим. Один нюанс – від потужного стусана в безодню може полетіти не тільки монстр, а і ваш товариш. Також це стосується різних предметів і магії. Немає нічого кращого ніж смерть від необережно кинутої товаришем бомби.

Висновок. Просто чума. Не дивлячись на прісне звукове супроводження у гри є просто тони позитивних моментів. А додаткові персонажі, режими складності, рандом і режим виживання не дадуть вам сумувати навіть після n-го проходження.

30224184.review:
[h1]¿C.ulo o codo?[/h1]

Rampage Knigths es un armígero juego "beat 'em up" de temática medieval con un buen sistema de mazmorras aleatorias. A voz de pronto, se puede echar de menos el sistema de niveles con un orden predeterminado, pero una vez que luchas en este título, verás que su arbitraje no es un aspecto totalmente loco: sus escenarios y enemigos tienen un orden establecido, lo que cambia y da frescor a cada partida es la estructura y posiciones del mapa. El resultado es brillante pues no habrá dos sesiones de lucha iguales, el constante cambio es la propia vida del juego como una cueva sombría que se alargará hasta donde tus ojos no pueden ver.  

Aunque lo parezca, el sistema de mazmorras aleatorias no es el mejor punto de esta odisea bárbara. Existe otro apartado mejor: es su celebración de lo absurdo, la comedia indomable, el cachondeo excéntrico, el mundo de lo fiero e hilarante en su máximo exponente. Muda los aires de poción de salud por una que transforma tu cara en burro (ecos esenciales incluidos), el ítem de invencibilidad por el de ser un borracho que no se sostiene, la ayuda extra será una gorda dominatrix, el poder de la fuerza por un brazo mecánico con tajos inagotables, y la lista sigue y sigue con grandes ideas súmamente disparatadas. Todos los aspectos de esta aventura son muy variados: los enemigos, los ayudantes, las armas y escudos, cofres del tesoro, poderes mágicos, maldiciones e ítems especiales son un completo desmadre a la americana.

El control es impecable, jugabilidad en estado puro. Música y efectos de sonido perfectos. Su sistema de logros es la envidia de todos, ya que no se basa solo en conseguir y fardar, más bien son retos que superar y acumular para obtener beneficios en la partida, recompensas para personalizar a tu héroe de turno mediante una rauda cirugía, y también para desbloquear modos de juego variopintos y muy retadores para esos que quieren más y más. Tanto si te gusta el género como si no, no pierdas la oportunidad de afrontar esta disparatada pero brava aventura. Aquí descubrirás más que en otras hazañas llenas de aburridos dragones y simples mazmorras.

[b]Lo mejor:[/b] jugabilidad, diversidad en cada nivel, cooperativo local u online, su esencia 100% cómica, la funcionalidad de sus logros.
[b]Lo peor:[/b] en España el juego ha pasado bastante desapercibido. Sus pocos textos y las explicaciones de pócimas y demás aparejos son en inglés.

29813734.review:
I thought this game was early access when it was gifted to me by a friend, I didn't realise it was a full release. I'd say in this state it's not a worthwhile purchase, it's essentially a less polished version of 'Lost Castle'. The combat is janky, the controls can be unpredictable and the game itself is buggy and appears to be prone to disconnecting frequently in co-op. 

My biggest complaint is that we bought this for the co-op, but frankly it's not enjoyable with the friendly-fire the way it is currently. The game is a hack and slash, so the screen can sometimes become a bit of a cluster-fuck sometimes, which 90% of the time lead to either my friend or me being bashed into the air over and over which then gets us both killed. Seriously, the friendly-fire-but-not-quite (you can hit each other with literally anything you do, spells, scrolls, attacks, but none of it does any damage, just knocks the other player around) is incredibly frustrating, and is the reason we stopped playing this game. I'm going to be trying to get a steam gift refund for my friend who gifted it to me. I might check on this game again in 6 months, but if you're considering getting it I'd advise getting Lost Castle instead, it's the exact same game but with a much better design.

Don't get me wrong, I don't mind frustrating games. I loved the Dark Souls series, and I don't mind difficult and grindy rogue-likes. This game isn't frustrating because it's challenging, or because the enemies are too hard, or anything like that. It's frustrating as a result of broken mechanics and poor design choices.

Final thoughts;

I cannot recommend this game. It feels like a sloppy rip-off of Lost Castle, and is extremely frustrating (but not in the good way).

29799199.review:
I got this for christmas from a friend who I was highly appreciative (I finally had time to install and play this) of because upon seeing this game I was thinking a beat 'em up with RPG elements that are similar to "Dungeon Fighter ONLINE" or it's own beast. Oh boy was I wrong. Rampage Knights is a Rouge-like hack 'n' slash beat 'em up.  I am not a fan of rouge-likes I find them tedious and pointless as most of them is just "Get as far as you can and no ending for you" this isn't the days of atari and an ending is something I want in a game to prove my skills were enough to complete said game.  

 I like the graphic style. Very cartoony,bright colors and smooth animation. The music isn't bad I liked the forest level tune the best out of the little I played of this game. The controls are a bit clunky however and the gameplay itself feels unpolished. I am guessing that the point of the game is to learn the enemy patterns while dodging and attack when it's "time" This wouldn't be bad but I found myself getting frustated by swinging at the enemy and no contact is made (I.E. Bad collision).  The casual mode helps but if you could unlock and buy equipment in the game to help out instead of being given some crap random weapon would have been nice.  

My main complaint is the difficulty. It ruins the game. I understand there is a "Hardcore" fanbase for games like these but I like to play games to have fun and have a bit of a challenge to see it through but when you don't have a way to go into battle prepared it tends to take away the enjoyment factor if it had a shop in town to upgrade gear I would have liked it more. but again this is a rouge-like and the beat 'em up genre is a favorite of mine which suckered me into wanting this. I suppose it's time to uninstall and find something else to play that I haven't gotten around to installing. I couldn't like this and don't recommend UNLESS YOU LIKE ROUGE LIKES.

29791322.review:
I'm a bit torn on how to rate this game...
It's easy enough to see the appeal it will have to the average beat 'em up fan for the following reasons:

- Combat is fairly entertaining due to satisfying feedback on hitting enemies. Weak attacks still visibly stun enemies for a short moment. Stronger attacks throw them around forcefully, rendering them prone and defenseless to getting picked from the ground and thrown again. Single normal-sized foes can be defeated easily, but with time.

- Difficulty can be challenging, due to limit of lives and permadeath. A higher challenge level is probably the more popular option, with this type of game?!

- Replayability through randomization of levels, enemies and loot. New playable characters to unlock.

- Loot is very original and varied. Some of the weapons and armors have amazingly unusual traits. E.g. I found an armor that exploded on hit, not just once but repeatedly, whenever a foe landed a blow on me. The armor also granted me immunity to explosions.

- Very enjoyable when you can find a friend, who's addicted to progressing further in the maps, to play coop with.


Yet, here are the reasons why I'll probably never play it again:

- The basic combat you start out with (loot might change that?) is too limited in engaging variety, although the few moves available are well animated and impressive to perform/watch. 
There are 2 special moves that can be performed from a normal attack combo, a dash attack performed through charging a button press and a kick that is context sensitive and only triggers if you press attack while standing in a precise proximity to the foe (in other words, you cannot rely on it). All of these can be comboed in flashy ways, but it only rarely feels rewarding. There are usually only small amounts of enemies on screen and many (if not all) can move fairly swiftly. The difficulty of killing them lies in their big amounts of hitpoints and your weak beginning weapon (which you return to, after every permadeath).
Performing the same small amount of moves on the same enemies, over and over, had me tired of it after 15 minutes. 
The beat 'em ups that I enjoyed (e.g. "Warriors of Fate") had more combat variety. And I'd rather need a step up from that, in 2017.

- The loot is exciting...but you can never keep it! You die, it's gone.
 Discovering all of the items that are available can be enjoyable with a friend, I guess. But...

- The game is rather boring when you cannot find entertaining company for cooperative play.


Would I recommend the game? Yes, to fans of beat 'em ups without much combat variety.
Do I like the game, though? No.

29556634.review:
This game right out of the gate is extremely quirky and doesn't take itself seriously. It doesn't mind going crazy and doing really weird stuff. When you play you feel as though you are truly over powered but the enemies still pose a big threat and you if you get cocky you'll find yourself dead.

Hurray Classic Pro/Con review format but altered slightly to Strenghts/Weaknesses because I think it is slightly more fitting.

STRENGHTS:
+++ Really fun and enjoyable with a friend
++ Crazy weapon, spell, curse, disease, blessing, armor, equipables, potions, minions and the list goes on. Basically all the stuff you find is incredibly entertaining and fun to mess around with. A lot of the times when you see something new you go "FOR REAL??? THIS IS A THING??" And then you proceed to pick up and use said thing and see how horrible\amazing it actually is.
+Bosses! ***EXCEPT THE FINAL BOSS*** The bosses in this game are generally a tough challenge that take a lot of dodging and finessing to take down. A lot of the time they have weakness that must be exploited to win (Hurray strategy)
*Although some of the bosses are just recycled versions of enemies that do more damage which is kind of lame, its still feels like a challenge.

So those were the good things. Seems like a pretty fun game right? Well it is! and it is really addicting, however there are some things which are bad that can really soil the game for people. And I am one of those people. 

WEAKNESSES
------- THE FINAL BOSS. [spoiler]So you play through this tough game fighting and dying multiple times and restarting. Then finally you make it to the final boss and the first couple fazes are awesome! It's tough and he deals massive damage. Once you over come these fazes the stupidest thing happen that uproots everything you've done the entire game. You proceed to hop on a broomstick and the game turns into a 2D bullet hell game (Not even a good or difficult one) Why the game decides to thow all your weapons and spells and cool stuff that you got accustomed to and loved using out the window?? I have no clue. But After the final boss I stopped playing the game instantly. It was ruined for me after that point. But idk if that doesn't bother you go right on ahead.[/spoiler]
--- Music, Artstyle, Character design, Level design. Everything in this game looks and sounds low budget. Which it might have honestly been, but personally the games style and aesthetic don't appeal to me. Especially the character design.
-- Weird boss encounters? How can I do a run where I fight three bosses by the fourth area, and then the next run I don't fight a boss until the fifth area?? Seems messed up but I would have liked if some of the random generation was taken out in favor of having boss fights around the same time every run. But thats just me.
- Playable Characters. They could have done a lot better in this area of the game. There are only 6 playable characters and the most of them are pretty boring and generic. There are a few exceptions but for most of the time playing the game you will be working to unlock these characters and by the time you get them you will most likely be burnt out on playing the game.

Whoa TL\DR
This game is fun and addicting and if you have 18$ and are looking for a fun co-op game to play with your friend. Go for it. If not just wait for a sale. This game is worth it for 10$ or less. Just try not to play solo. Its boring solo.

29037611.review:
I really wanted to love this, I really effin' love brawlers and this looked so good. I tried to enjoy it, I really did, but it's just not a good brawler. Movement feels really clunky, attacking stops you dead, something's off about the horizontal planes or your attack's hitbox so enemies can be just slightly above you and your sword swings will completely miss, and combat's basically mashing a single attack button over and over. Granted, you can also press up, down and either left or right to do a directional attack, but it's not implemented well and is very awkward to perform as you have to be attacking your enemy before you can do it.

It's not all bad; there's a huge variety of weapons, items, spells and unlockables, and they're generally really well thought out. It's obvious a lot of work went into the RPG aspects of the game, and they work brilliantly because I'd constantly be weighing up whether a new spell was worth dropping an old one, or whether a potion should be drunk now or would the side effects screw me over, so in that regard the game's great. It's just a shame the movement and the combat just didn't seem to "click" for me, because I'd be more willing to retry that awful Pit and Pendulum boss if it handled better.

Also it has a lockpicking mini-game.

A lockpicking mini-game.

In a brawler.

Can't recommend.

28989768.review:
Этот отзыв сразу о двух очень похожих друг на друга игр.

Глядя на такие игры как Rampage Knights и Lost Castle понимаешь, что смесь жанров rogue-like и beat'em up игр прошла крайне успешно. Вариативность и рандом (подчас полностью меняющий ситуацию), которые свойственны всяким Binding of Isaac, очень хорошо сочетаются с боевой системой beat'em up'ов (Streets of Rage, Battle Toads, Double Dragon, из новых Castle crashers и Mother Russia Bleeds), а совместное прохождение за одним экраном и вовсе превращают игру в концентрированный фан. Качественное истребление руками\ногами\палками\мечами\топорами разномастных врагов в компании верного\й друга\подруги само по себе очень сильно доставляет, но когда в добавок к этому ты понятия не имеешь что будет тебя ждать за углом, а очередной найденный предмет может полностью изменить твоё поведение, концентрация веселья становится совсем уж запредельной.

В Rampage Knights мы имеем быструю динамику, очень забавный дизайн врагов и персонажей, толковый юмор (хотя ему далеко до Castle Crashers), разнообразные уровни.

В Lost Castle динамика поспокойнее, дизайн персонажей и уровней попроще, юмор похуже, но всё это она компенсирует очень разным снаряжением. В Рыцарях мы большую часть времени машем палкой\мечом\топором, которые отличаются друг от друга только циферкой урона, длиной, да наличием например яда, но суть неизменна. Хотя иногда в дело вступают заклинания, да и наличие нескольких классов добавляет разнообразия. Но в Lost Castle в плане оружия и возможных тактик вариативности куда больше.

Мне очень понравились обе и я считаю, что пробовать нужно оба проекта, а там уж что больше понравится. Я не возьмусь называть одну игру лучше другой, они похожи в базовых принципах, но разные в деталях. Спор о том, какая игра лучше, так же глуп, как и спор о том, какой шутер лучше - Quake 3 или Unreal Tournament, кто помнит начало нулевых и эти срaчи вокруг этих сетевых стрелялок, те меня поймут.

Имея в итоге такой взрывной коктейль хороших драк, рандома рогаликов и кооператива, даже не хочется искать в нём какие-то недостатки.

28989217.review:
Remember ye olden days when you played games like Streets of Rage or Double Dragon? Rampage Knights is a beat 'em up game where you travel along slashing and bashing enemies and crushing them beneath your feet. Much like the aforementioned games, this is also a cooperative game. You can play it with friends online or with local shared/split screen.

Along with the beat 'em up gameplay, it also has rogue-like elements to it. You go along through randomly generated areas and rooms, fighting against an array of enemies or having to avoid a fair many hazards. You can also gather items or spells along with equipping gear you might find to help you along the way. Along with these though, there are also diseases and curses which can hinder and harm you in different ways.

The game is likely best played in multiplayer with a friend. You won't find any friendly fire happening (at least at Normal difficulty) so you won't have any issues in that department, but some curses can effect both you and your friend as you go along. Watch out though if your friend throws an explosive - or watch out for your friends when you throw them.

Considering the strengths of the game, I wouldn't necessarily recommend it for its single player - but if you have a friend you are looking to play with, then a recommend picking it up the 2-pack on offer and playing it with them.

28979229.review:
[h1]Rampage Knight: Un roguelike col cazzo duro.[/h1]
Partiamo con il dire che questo è un gioco che va [b]Necessariamente[/b] giocato con amici.
Il gioco se giocato da solo non è un granchè in quanto raggiunge i limiti dell'impossibile.
Ma se giocato con amici, le strategie e le modalità di gioco applicabili si moltiplicano diventando praticamente infinite.
Il titolo è fantastastico, decisamente divertente e poco ripetitivo: purchè, anche nelle prime fasi di gioco, esso risulti essere molto, ma molto difficile.
Il sistema di assegnazione dei tasti, non è dei migliori: risultano relativamente scomodi e vi ci vorrà un pochino di pratica per ottenere una certa dimestichezza con questi ultimi.
In sostanza...
Rampage Knight è un gioco assolutamente da avere: sopratutto se giocato con amici.
[b]Voto 7.5/10[/b]

[strike][h1]初上手评测[/h1][/strike]
[h1]游戏差不多全成就的评测[/h1]

很喜欢这一类的游戏，却在一年多之后才入手的这款游戏，实感惭愧。
先来聊聊这款游戏的优点吧。通过这不到9个小时的游戏时间，大概已经体会到了很多游戏中不错的元素：
[olist]
[*][b]多人合作[/b]：
因为刚毅入手这个游戏就和朋友一起玩耍的，所以游戏过程中给我最大的感受就是游戏多人模式的欢乐[spoiler]恶意[/spoiler]。
在游戏过程中，自己的攻击不会对队友造成伤害，却能造成对敌人般同等的僵直和击飞效果。
[spoiler]我终于可以把朋友打下悬崖还能一脸正经的说自己不是故意的了[/spoiler]
除此之外，只要不是两个玩家同时死亡，游戏就不会结束，也就是说如果其中的一个玩家死亡了，会转变为灵魂状态。在这个过程中需要在打倒12个敌人(解锁成就后只需10个)或者进入下一关[spoiler]然后这一关所有的宝贝都是自己的了(手动眼斜)[/spoiler]，我们就可以使队友复活。当然，即使自己处于灵魂状态，还是能够对敌人造成物理干扰，并且还能继续帮助（坑）队友哦。
[*][b]ACT元素[/b]：
通过一些按键的组合，你可以以不同的方式攻击敌人。譬如当你近身敌人的时候，可以踢击(Kick)敌人，也能够在敌人倒地状态时对其进行践踏(Stomp)。践踏和踢击效果真不错，在前期伤害都很可观。另外游戏中你能够蓄力攻击(锄地剑法)和前冲攻击(蓄力普攻+左右方向键)，见人多就冲进去；也能够将敌人抓起来，当投掷武器用。
[*][b]男人才会懂得浪漫——冷兵器[/b]
[*]后面的正在施工[spoiler]词穷想不出什么来了[/spoiler]
[/olist]
[h1]优缺点评价[/h1]
[b]优点[/b]
[list]
[*]魔性的多人合作
[*]动作多可以各种浪。因为人物的僵直时间比较常，所以建议不要太过贪刀。
[*]不错的roguelike元素。主要还是体现在道具的多样性，被动道具数量和可玩性还是很不错的。
[*]各种富有喜剧效果的诅咒
[/list]
[b]缺点[/b]
[list]
[*]背景乐平平
[*]人物动作略显僵硬
[/list]

28884363.review:
I bought this game on the premise that it's similar to Binding of Isaac and Castle Crashers. It has not disappointed in the least. The game is difficult, but not so much that it's unfair. It has procedurally generated levels so it's different all the time. There are a wealth of crazy upgrades that keep the game from getting stale as you're always getting new items and no two runs are ever the same. There are also a bunch of different classes that work differently enough as to make them feel unique from one another.

The best part is that it's co-op. I didn't know I wanted a co-op Binding of Isaac type game until now. Probably one of the most fun games I've played in a while. The core gameplay is a ton of fun. If you enjoy rogue-likes and brawlers with a good dose of comedy, you'll like this game.

UM ROGUELIKE COM UMA CAMERA EM SIDESCROLING, PARECENDO MUITO COM OS GAMES RETROS.

OS MAPAS SÃO GERADOS ALEATORIAMENTES ASSIM COMO OS INIMIGOS, A MOVIMENTAÇÃO, O DESIGNER E A JOGABILIDADE É BEM SIMPLES, VC TEM UM BOTÃO DE ATAQUE, PODE ROLAR E PULAR, TEM O BOTÃO DE AGARRAR E FAZER AÇÃO, E TBM TEM O BOTÃO DE USAR ITEM...

NOTA: 8/10
