28550149.review:
Great game after 52 hours in.

Just like its description, this is pretty much a beat'em up game but it certainly involves some battle tactics like jumping, dodging, item uses, etc. Players start with adventurer and proceed to unlock other classes after completing some achievements. What makes the game addictive is that as players go deeper, rooms are getting more difficult with more enemies and enemies that attack quite often, but by completing some achievements they grant players some better start-off stats as well as better utility throughout the whole run. It took me at least 15 hours to complete all those achievements that gives actual benefit in battle and survival, and I did plan ahead before I play so it might take even longer for casual players.

What's after the achievements? They've got difficult areas such as Arena where you fight waves of monsters and try to survive, Endless dungeon which is really tricky to survive with curses and disease that you MUST take in later floors, Shadow World with insane difficulty and random classes with random stats which is quite challenging.

I do highly recommend playing this game with a friend online or local because it has so much more fun than just playing it alone. I wish the game could have a larger item pool with more randomization as well as more weapons and fighting styles that can lead to better variety in battle.

28538382.review: Не интересно. С графикой особо не заморачивались. Нет мелкой анимации.

28494006.review:
This game is really strange. It puts on this facade of being cartoony and goofy, and just your average rogue-like beat em' up. What you don't see in the first few playthroughs is the potential for this game to force you to refute the comfort and consistency of a normal gaming experience, and make you deeply question what makes you keep pressing on in the face utter madness and unfairness.

The answer to that question can be broken into two parts. 
1. Your skill.
           The player actually has a pretty big influence in their success. There are no dice rolls, this game is a pure and simple beat em up, with a surprisingly fluid combat system.

2. Beating the game. And once you get to the endless dungeon, more importantly, killing the ever-loving christ out of Rolf Ironbutt.
          Do you think that's a funny name? DO YOU THINK IT'S A FUNNY NAME???? I'M SURE YOU WILL BE LAUGHING. I'M 100% SURE YOU WILL BE LAUGHING WHEN YOU MEET HIM, AND IT'S NOT BECAUSE OF ANYTHING FUNNY. 

You will spend hours in the dungeons amassing countless curses, learning to fight rooms of at least 20, 30 mobs with a giant foot creating a steady breeze running up your back from crashing behind you every 5 seconds, as you run FRANTICALLY, in the DARK, TRYING TO LIFESTEAL YOUR SIGNIFICANTLY LOWERED, CONSTANTLY DRAINING HEALTH, ALL THE WHILE AVOIDING A SINGLE STRIKE ON THE EXPLOSIVE BARRELS RAINING FROM THE SKY EVERY ROOM, WHICH CAN LEAD TO MOST OF YOUR PRECIOUS HP DISSAPEARING, OR JUST ENDING YOUR RUN FOR NO REASON, BECAUSE MORE THAN LIKELY A *GIANT FUCKING FOOT* WILL COME DOWN AND REMOVE THE REST OF YOUR HP ONCE YOU GET STUNNED BY ONE OF THOSE BARRELS.

And then... you wil meet Rolf. You will step out of the shadows into floor 25 bloody and disheveled, and face this boss. You will then embrace and appreciate the nature of this unstable game, and realize how his death rests timidly upon the precipice of true lunacy and obsession. 

You have to deal with a fresh hell every run. Your character will become increasingly grotesque the further you venture into the dungeons, as will your thoughts and feelings. You either accept the madness or fight it, but your efforts are in vain if you do not make it out alive.

28275836.review:
I do not like most rogue-alikes for their lack of local co-op experience, but this one successfully blends the side-scrolling beat-em-up interface (read easy to use and applicable to local co-op) with the fun ot finding new equipment. There's no character advancement other than your inventory, but the potential items to discover are so rich and varied that it ends up feeling like changing classes depending on what you find.

The startling shock of the game is when, after a few hours progressing with laughter and groans through the dungeon, you "win." At that point, your characters are suddenly deleted and re-made somewhat randomly. There's no sense of continuity between games other than the very slow unlocking of strange play levels or odd hats for your character to wear. 

Despite this (I find) rather unpleasant "reward" for winning, we have continued to play it night after night for a single quick run through the dungeon. An absolutely great drinking and being ridiculous.

28216719.review:
This game is a blast! Even at full price this game is worth every penny. Every run is different, so there is a ton of replayability. 
Here are some things I really like about Rampage Knights:
+ Very nice cartoon style graphics.
+ Lots of different enemies to fight. 
+ Every run is different.
+ Perma-death can be disabled by setting the game to easy mode. I wish more perma-death games had this feature.
+ Very tight and responsive controls. Controller support works flawlessly.
+ Very well polished overall.
+ Great character progression.
+ Every class plays very differently.
+ Cross platform online multiplayer and split screen local multiplayer.
+ Plenty of different game modes and challenges.

At 12 dollars, this game is worth every penny. There's a lot of content here with a ton of replayability.

27810825.review:
Very fun local co-op game that I'm playing with my girlfriend. We're currently trying to beat the game on Insane and although it's frustrating at times, we've had a lot of fun with it so far. 

Pros:
Challenging but fair combat.
Fun items and upgrades(There's a spell called Freedom Giver that lets you fly around and drop bombs)
Funny humor. Duck disease is the worst.
Classes are diverse enough to change up gameplay.
Easy to learn, hard to master. 

The only con I can think of is level diversity could have been a little better, though the combat makes up for this because it's so fun and you're usually focused on that. There's pretty much a forest level at the start, then castle levels after that that don't seem too much different.

Some people might see the difficulty/RNG elements as cons, but I see those as good things.

To sum up I would have paid 5x the sale price and been happy with my purchase.

Rampage Knights - это рогалик,в котором,играя соло или в коопе вы загляните на огонек к толпам разномастной нечести с боссами в комплекте.Причем,пробегая по комнатам с подленьким окружением (ловушки на любой вкус,цвет и запах), и собирая всевозможное вспомогательное барахлишко,будете надеяться, что именно в этот раз у вам получится затоптать все лица и все таки добраться до заветного  конца похода.И так снова и снова....При этом,имея "пряморукий" порог вхождения,освоение не занимает много времени,а так как  это все сдобрено хорошим юмором и увесистым объемом фана,удовольствие от игры не на один вечер вам обеспечено.

27055067.review:
Игра,  в которой тебя норовит заовнить бочка, игра, в которой картина может пырнуть тебя ножом, игра, где даже убив врага, он может встать из могилы и снова тебя покрошить. Хардкорность действительно зашкаливает, особенно если вы играете кооп, то экран буквально превращается в месиво из врагов и иногда бывает трудно понять, где враг,а где твой товарищ. Это наверное единственный минус, так как часто спихиваешь камрада в пропасть. 
Несколько слов по поводу геймплея. 
Во-первых, это несколько классов героя, которые открываются со временем, и тут уже Вам решать, хотите ли вести ближний бой, имея много хп, или контрить врагов на расстоянии, позволяя делать всю грязную работу демонам и магии. Разновидностей врагов пруд пруди: это обычные скелеты, орки, зомбаки, рыцари, разнообразная нечесть из ада, алхимики, старушка смерть и прочие гоблины-мутанты. Стоит отметить различные предметы, которые находишь по ходу игры.Так называемых хранителей можно купить в тавернах на некоторых уровнях + огромное количество шмота, дающего очень разные эффекты (как положительные, так и отрицательные). 
Всё это, в довесок с приятной мультяшной графикой, заберет у вас не один вечер в компании с другом. Рекомендую начинать с самого легкого уровня сложности, дабы понять, что Вас ждёт, а пройдя не очень длинную "сюжетку", имеет смысл погрузиться в "бесконечное подземелье", которое уж точно заставит понервничать.

26944145.review: Rampage Knights es un clasico Beat'EmAll, fácil de jugar difícil de dominar. El juego se caracteriza por su acción frenética en     cuartos ordenados aleatoriamente dentro de sus diferentes niveles. De hecho el factor aleatorio es un componente que hace único a este juego, ya que puedes encontrate con los jefes en cualquier orden (exceptuando al jefe final) y además el botín que encuentras en los cofres es aletorio. Esto obliga al jugador a buscar la estrategia adecuado acorde al equipamiento que se tiene en ese momento, llegando a combinaciones de lo más desatrosas o poderosas. Con varios modos de juego y distintos grados dificultad Rampage Knights es una compra segura para los que gozan de el genero  y que brinda muchas horas de diversión, que se multiplican en compañia de un amigo.

26395653.review:
"Mais um jogo indie qualquer para fazer volume na biblioteca?"

Definitivamente não!

O que esse jogo traz na sua proposta e remeter a um estilo de diversão e desafio de jogos da era 16 bits. *Essa análise foi feita se baseando no modo cooperativo.

Se você lembra de ter jogado The King of Dragons(SNES) e similares da época o jogo se baseia nessa simplicidade, andar, bater, pegar power-ups, entrar em masmorras, porem tudo isso com um visual mais animado e engraçado, conforme prossegue na aventura vai desbloqueando classes e modos de jogo e o que mais remete a esses jogos é a sua forma de checkpoints que literalmente não existe, morreu já era começa a aventura do zero(exceto no modo Casual que começa do mesmo mapa onde morreu) e fora as pegadinhas, armadilhas, referências a grandes clássicos dos games e cinema que não vou detalhar para não dar spoiler.

Simplesmente fantástico, para quem é das antigas e tiver a oportunidade de jogar em modo coop eu o recomendo.

26368309.review:
通关撒花：暴虐骑士，一款带有随机要素的横版动作游戏，可本地合作和网络联机，2名玩家通力合作过关。联机是steam直连，基本无延迟，效果不错。虽然看起来与失落城堡很像，但并不一样。

没有属性加点系统：死亡以后没有任何继承，完全是从头再来。玩家只能凭着操作与人品通关，而不能通过反复刷来获得加成以降低游戏难度。这对于手残玩家来说不算是个好消息，但可以凭借欧皇血统翻身也算是留有余地了。

杀怪复活机制：玩家死亡以后会变成鬼魂到处飘荡，复活需要队友杀死10个怪攒魂献祭。鬼魂状态下的玩家不能捡东西，但可以进行攻击造成怪物硬直，为队友减轻压力和争取时间。队友之间相互攻击也会造成硬直，虽然不掉血但关键时刻也是很坑的。两人都死亡以后游戏从当前关卡重新开始，而不需要从整个游戏的初始位置开始。

开锁小游戏：游戏里全部的箱子都带锁，需要玩家通过小游戏来开锁。开锁失败可能会扣血，残血状态下开锁失败简直是雪上加霜，但不开锁就意味着得不到补给。比较考验动态视力和手速的配合，但熟悉规律以后并不难。

搞怪的道具系统：捡起药水之前一定记得看看效果，喝下去产生莫名其妙脸变成屁股、跑起来就停不下来之类的效果让人又尴尬又好笑，还有减少生命上限之类的坑爹效果。非洲血统还可能从祭坛惹出大脚丫追着玩家踩，过关也不会消失，打怪还要躲脚丫。

解锁职业与成就系统挂钩：除了第一个默认职业之外，其他的5个职业都需要达成相应的成就才能获得，因此有意向解锁全职业的玩家需要研究一下对应的成就如何完成，在职业选择界面会提示解锁条件。

缺点是不显示联机好友的头像物品等信息，也不提示对方位置，行动中走散以后只能慢慢找过去，因此尽量一起行动。

说来惭愧：和小伙伴玩了几次都打不过去，结果心血来潮开了个公共房，进来的路人直接带通关，感谢路人。总体上来说是一款很好玩的合作闯关游戏，推荐和小伙伴联机玩耍。

26339904.review:
Very fun local co-op game that I'm playing with my girlfriend. We're currently trying to beat the game on Insane and although it's frustrating at times, we've had a lot of fun with it so far. 

Pros:
Challenging but fair combat.
Fun items and upgrades(There's a spell called Freedom Giver that lets you fly around and drop bombs)
Funny humor. Duck disease is the worst.
Classes are diverse enough to change up gameplay.
Easy to learn, hard to master. 

The only con I can think of is level diversity could have been a little better, though the combat makes up for this because it's so fun and you're usually focused on that. There's pretty much a forest level at the start, then castle levels after that that don't seem too much different.

Some people might see the difficulty/RNG elements as cons, but I see those as good things.

To sum up I would have paid 5x the sale price and been happy with my purchase.

26085250.review:
不知不觉这个游戏已经玩了100多个小时了，已经忘了当初为什么会买这个游戏。跟男朋友通关很多次了但是还是能一直玩下去。总结一下大概就这么几点吧：

1.道具有趣而且多。武器、药水、主动技能...个人认为这个很重要，每次都有不一样的道具组合，总有新鲜感。
2.操作简单，打击感强。没有复杂的按键和乱七八糟的技能，就是一直打，就喜欢这种简单粗暴就是莽的游戏，贼过瘾。
3.双人联机。看评论里有人自己玩那么长时间...嗯很强。这也正说明了游戏轻松解压好玩吧。这个游戏更适合喜欢动作类游戏情侣玩，难度合适。

至于画面什么的...个人还是很喜欢这种有点丑得有趣的风格的吧。我不觉得关少，这是那种让你反复刷的游戏。累一天了回来玩一玩，一晚上1.2个小时就能通关我觉得挺好。还有很多加分比如BGM挺带感啊、可以给角色换各种有趣的帽子啊、各种成就啊职业啊什么的。玩了这么长时间的，觉得对于这种体量的游戏来说已经很可以了。

总之这是一个轻松有趣、简单解压的游戏。

Not worth the price - combat's very shallow and the "end boss" is  a side scroller shooting mission which was really not well received. You spend the whole game (30 minutes - not kididng) collecting powerful items to defeat foes - only to end up not being able to use any of them on the end boss. In fact, the game takes all of the items away and throws non-stop healing potions at you while you play the side scroller.  Really, really poor design.  

Quick summary:
- Short (once you spend about an hour getting the hang of the game - a successful run will take you under 30 minutes). 

- Repetitive (the other classes aren't varied enough - so what if one can double jump? There's no platforming in the game...)

- Items are varied but get overshadowed by the primary weapon of just hitting X to attack. 

- Rooms are sometimes completely empty and devoid of anything to do in them.

Not sure where all the hype came from for this game.

Better Rouge-likes to buy( All of which are at this same price range and are far superior.)
-Enter the Gungeon
-Nuclear Throne
-Rogue Legacy
-Binding of Isaac     

Do not recommend this game at all.

25909639.review:
I can't help but notice that I haven't left a review for this great game yet, so let me do that here. This review will contain minor spoilers about the enemies, weapons, and mechanics. 

There are a few different class types, and all play differently, so variety seekers this is a treat for you.

Rampage Knights is a fantastic beat 'em up game that features procedural generation. Now, let me talk about the mechanics of the procedural generation and the game.

PG (procedural generation)- There is a set pool of weapons on each level, I believe, or every two levels. The starting level basically teaches you how to play the game, while the very first combat room of the second stage offers you a glimpse into the power ups and weapons. There are 3-5 weapons available on the second level, and they go from a slower club that stuns on critical hit, to a poisonous sword that poises enemies (not skeletons though, look out!), and my personal favorite in the form of a dagger. It's short, so your range is limited, but it's fast and does +50 critical damage on hit. And that's just a few weapons on that stage that CAN pop up. 

At first, I said "oh, so I'll either get A-D on this level, meh, I want it to be random." After completing the game multiple times (look at my hours in the past week, insane mode is hard, man), I can safely say that the system is a wonderful one. If every weapon in the game was able to drop on the second floor, I'd be incredibly overpowered, and then later severely screwed.  

This is because modifiers exist, such as curses. On Insane mode, you get a new curse every floor. On the other modes, you don't, unless you are forced to trigger a demonic statue. This can happen only once per run. What does a curse do? It varies! The most tragic one, to me, is "Animated". All the barrels that you've been smashing for gold pieces and health pick ups? Yeah, they are enemies now. And man, there are LOTS of boxes, statues, barrels and more in this game to smash.

Which brings us to the mechanics- Your standard attack is mashable to create as big of a combo as you want. You won't be doing that though, as in instead you'll hold the attack button and dash forward. Why? It breaks shields, and man do you want to break the shields of the enemies, trust me. If you press attack and up, you launch enemies in mid air. Follow it up with pressing attack, and you do a neat combo that ends with them on the ground. If you're close to an enemy, you do a punt, which also ends up with them on the ground. Once there, you can stomp them for a lot of damage, but be careful, you become very vulnerable to any attack while stomping an enemy.  For defense, you have an excellent and easy to use doge roll that becomes incredibly difficult to master when shit hits the fan. 

The variety of enemies is good. We've got knights, demons, goblins, undead, giants, trolls, crazy chickens, Halloween looking fuckers with swords that throw pumpkins at you, and more.

There is one final boss who has a very cool final form (won't spoil that one), and a mid point boss. Actually, the midpoint boss draws from a pool of I believe 5, so it will be different each time you play.  They are tough, but very fair after you learn what you need to do to defeat them.

Potions range from hilarious to useful, but not a single one feels pointless or tacked on. Diseases, such as being poisoned, can be cured with a variety of potions, but do you really want your character to be drunk, making movement difficult for a few rooms?

Overall, I really enjoyed my time with Rampage Knights, and I'm excited to go back to it. The developers put their own unique spin on a classic formula, threw in some humor, a doge roll and tons of love. 

And I, for one, am very thankful that they did so.

25893937.review:
Esquemáticamente sería una disolución entre los componentes Lucha a progresión en plano 3D lateral y Roguelike. Una resonancia aceptable que se creará entre estos dos elementos para representar un juego técnico, adictivo, aleatorio, variable y cerrado bajo un conjunto de reglas. Un trayecto parejo y parecido de 1 hora pero muy condicionado a lo que nos encontremos y nuestra forma de jugar.

Rampage Kinghts parte de base sobre la jugabilidad de la lucha a progresión lateral de los retro, representando inicialmente un trayecto parejo y parecido. Para ello se han puesto o se han intentado tener cuidados especiales en el control del personaje y la inteligencia artificial, para así, cuando llegue el momento de añadir el Roguelike, la mezcla resultante cuente con componentes de calidad que muestren una alta resonancia en su mecánica.
La lucha a progresión y el trayecto lineal quedarán acoplados y adaptadados a los principios del Roguelike para configurar un sistema de salas pregeneradas y una diversidad de objetos, datos y estados, sin embargo sus principios básicos siempre estarán presentes para recordarnos cuál es su base.

Combates.
Los combates se sucederán cuando entremos en las salas, las puertas se cerrarán y en un instante aparecerán los enemigos para tener una lucha hasta el final.
La IA actuará muy bien, moviendo o controlando a los enemigos y su iniciativa para realizar algo.
La lucha quedará adaptada en su mayor parte a jugar condicionados por nuestro equipamiento que habremos encontrado o comprado en salas aleatorias anteriores y en cofres de tesoro abiertos.
Los combates tienen una configuracion bastante alta en el control y acciones gracias a su escenario en 3D, y su fluidez quedará marcada por la iniciativa nuestra y la I.A en actuar frente a todas las posibilidades de atacar o proceder en un combate entre varios.

Personaje.
La aleatoriedad es muy alta y ningún personaje será igual si empezamos siempre con el mismo, porque hay 6 clases para escoger: aventurero, bárbaro, pirata con su loro, asesino, brujo y hechicero. Estas dos últimas clases son dedicadas a la magia, consiguiendo muchísimas jugabilidades distintas. 
El personaje lleva un arma que tiene un alcance, un daño, una velocidad de ataque y unas posibles propiedades.
El personaje lleva un equipamiento basado en el calzado, el cinturón y la armadura que le darán beneficios de todo tipo.
El personaje contará con 4 tipos de acciones basados en 4 tipos distintos de objetos de uso rápido: magia, arma a distancia, pergamino y poción. El paralelismo entre los 4 objetos será uno de los componentes principales de la aleatoriedad y probabilidad porque solo podemos llevar de un tipo o uno a la vez, esto se conjugará con el control del personaje para concluir una solidez en su desarrollo. 
Otro tipo de objetos muy valiosos serán los permanentes, ya que con sólo cogerlo nos beneficiaremos de sus propiedades hasta el final. Este tipo de objetos le aportará magia y esencia.
El personaje podra ser alterado negativamente por medio de maldiciones, envenenamientos y enfermedades; tendremos que tener muy regulado este tema.

Equilibrio, estabilidad.
Se aplica un ancajonamiento a los datos fundamentales que sería la vida y la fuerza + daño de arma a medidas aproximadas de 1 a 100. Una vida alta sería 90 y una vida jodida sería 40, que es la que tiene el brujo al empezar. No existe una reducción de armadura con lo que todos los hits será una resta de la fuerza de impacto a la vida, con lo que un daño total de 50 acabaría con nosotros en dos golpes o menos. Los primeros enemigos en normal tendrán más o menos una fuerza de 5 + 3 daño del arma. 
Muy pocas cosas van a permitir alteral mucho estos datos a menos que sea en sacrificio del otro dato. Existe una poción que nos dará 50 o más de fuerza(algo bárbaro) y nos dejará pelados de vida, el equilibrio por esta parte estará asegurado para cerrar partidas completas sobre estos datos primordiales.

Aleatoriedad y probabilidad
El juego se estructura por 8 niveles seguidos y cada nivel son unas 8-9 salas casi sucesivas. De 2 a 4 salas por nivel pueden ser especiales; el 35% de las salas serán de buen ver para alterar la monotonia del combate, conteniendo objetos ya nombrados anteriormente y que por medio de beneficios o efectos negativos nos cambiarán al personaje, muchas de ellas desaparecen con el tiempo al avanzar por las salas.

Logros, repetitividad y vida del juego.
Los logros quedan totalmente asociados a la jugabilidad y conseguirlos nos dará esa experiencia acumulativa para conseguir hacer las partidas primeras más difíciles y luego ser un veterano.
La vida y diversión del juego queda casi regulada a la consecución de los logros porque siempre tenemos el mismo escenario y las mismas luchas. Su mayor problema va a ser hacer en un 50% las mismas cosas ya que los enemigos... no dan mucho de sí y empezarán a resultar molestos.
A través de varios personajes y otros modo de juego intenta reducir esto pero no llega a ser suficiente, seguiremos acabando una y otra vez con oleadas de enemigos de una forma en el fondo igual.
Este último dato negativo lo hace funcionalmente muy limitado con lo que su vida será breve.

25322911.review:
Rampage Knights – ураганный beat 'em up рогалик (да, опять рогалик, но на этот раз совершенно особенный). Примечателен он не только своей потрясающей рисовкой, но и достаточным уровнем хардкорности, особенно, в специальном режиме (учитесь умирать красиво, граждане). 
------
Тут все как у взрослых проектов: случайно генерируемые подземелья, куча разнообразных монстров, элементы РПГ, вещи со своими уникальными свойствами, и проклятья. Да, проклятья, одна из движущих сил игры, они могут серьезно усложнить/укоротить вам жизнь, или, что менее вероятно, помочь в прохождении, но от них не скрыться. Муахахаха... 
------
Традиционно, сюжет вроде есть, но его, по сути, и нет. В игре существует шесть классов, серьезно влияющих на геймплей, из которых изначально доступен только один, остальные открываются по мере прохождения игры и выполнения заданий.
------
Реиграбельность игры крайне высокая, благо, этому способствует кооператив, в котором от веселого frendly fire'a не скрыться.
------
Вывод: Игра однозначно заслуживает внимания, и это лучший выбор, если думаете, во что поиграть с другом.

24916914.review:
* Difficult but Fair Brawler with a New Experience Each Time * 

Rampage Knights is a game I can recommend to most beat-em up fans.  It is truly Nintendo Hard with only 2 lives in a single player mode to fight your way to the final boss, with extra lives being a mechanic available to a single class (which starts out with none in reserve) or pure luck.

Despite the scarce resources and brutally punishing difficulty, I felt 99% of my deaths were fair -- I could have prevented them by dodging some other way, positioning myself better, or using an item earlier.  Even the small percentages of deaths that were almost beyond my control could have been within it if I had just done something a little differently.

The luck element still plays a factor, but not to the degree of Binding of Isaac where the RNG can make a run nigh impossible or incredibly easy.  Despite the curses, diseases and odds, each class has the tools they need to win with just their base abilities -- afflictions only limit how many mistakes you can make, and there's always a way around them (although this is luck based).

In the standard game, the right gear can make you nigh invulnerable with even serious mistakes being easily recoverable in the next room.  The standard game provides four difficulties, from Casual (which will allow you to see the ending eventually with perserverence) to Normal (NES hard) to Hard (NES Ninja Gaiden without the ability to continue hard) to Insane (even harder).  Casual can be beaten in under 30 min if you know what your'e doing; and even Insane has a few items that will allow you to turn your disadvantages into overwhelming power.

For those looking for a bigger challenge, in the Endless Dungeon game you can't rely on luck -- just about every additional edge will be stripped from you eventually (although by that point if you're still alive your skills are so great that the only chance the game has to kill you is waiting for you to make that one, fatal mistake).  You can plan for this eventualities but other than that, your tactics and reflexes are the only things you can count on.

I haven't even unlocked the Shadow World.

Despite my talking about how difficult the game is, I have to stress it is FAIR.  There's nothing stopping you from using every dirty trick in the book against your opponents and you're encouraged to do so.  Knock the giant off a cliff, endless combo your foes, use fallen enemies as projectiles, toss them into the abyss, throw everything at the room at everything else, abuse the hell out of your magic.  The room will kindly drop your rewards in safe areas so you never have to worry about being unable to claim your power-up just because you tossed a guy into a pit or killed him so his body is lying on a trap.

The base combat itself is simple but entertaining.  You have an almonst-invincible roll, a shield-destroying power-slash, a shield-destroying, staggering jumping attack, the ability to giant-swing fallen enemies to harm everyone around you, and the ability to throw most things at other things, which is a lot more useful then it sounds since throw enemies tend to knock each other down.  You also have a higly damaging air-combo, best saved for isolated or well-grouped enemies.

To this, add slots for magic abilities you can find in various points of the game (not super-common but common enough than you will have the luxury of choice), very common projectile weapons (common enough that it's a good idea to always use them as appropriate; you will find more), a single-use scroll slot, and a potion slot. 

Your equipment consists of melee weapon, armour (if available), belt, boots, and gloves, all of which confer various benefits to help keep you alive.

You also can have various familiars to assist your quest -- as many as you can find in the standard game, and up to three in Endless Dungeon.  Some of these stack beautifully and can utterly destroy your foes, while others can accidentally kill you due to the area effect -- but their nature is readily apparent and you shouldn't need more than one experience to know what to pick up and when.

Finally, you have a wide variety of passive items that will increase your abilities -- to possible game-breaking extent in the Standard Game (but limited to 1 of each type in Endless Dungeon).

All these factors create a unique dungeon brawling experience, and best of all you're allowed to simply skip past all the enemies in the first two "floors" of the game -- so vetern players looking to get right to the meat can do so.

If you like brawling games but hate how repetitive they can be, then this is the game for you.

24834458.review:
Отзыв:
Классная игрушка, сначала очень интересно, но когда ты уже прошел всю игру (в том числе Shadow World), а так же получил все ачивки, тебе становится скучновато)))
---
Рекорд:
Рекорд на бесконечности - 111 лвл (~500 минут игры), игра сохранена на 111 лвле с топ вещами у меня и напарника))) Only Insane!
---
Советы:
А теперь советы по прохождению!
1) Как на изи пройти игру на Endless:
-Иметь хороший скилл (Not for Kraken Idol)
-Постоянно уворачиваться.
-Играть желательно за Варлока или Ассасина. (Лучше за Варлока)
-Бегаем на 1 локации и ищем золотой сундук или гроб (или мудрый гриб) и стараемся найти ПОЯС ПАЛАДИНА (Paladins Belt) он с синими ромбиками. - не смогли выбить? Ничего - перезапускаем (я раз 15 макс перезапуска чтобы выбить)
-У нас есть пояс - теперь можно не бояться проклятий)) и на изи пройти игру.
-Кстати если играете с другом (т.к. в одинучку по харду проходить - но можно), скажите ему, чтобы он не брал все сразу))
2) Как получить достижение (Defeat Iron Bat):
- выбиваем пояс паладина - возвращаемся в лагерь - идем в бесконечность - на 25 лвл будет Iron Bat - Profit)))
3) Как на изи пройти Shadow World:
-Иметь хорошего напарника
-Иметь прямые руки
4) Как играть на бесконечности без напряга и потняка:
-Выбить пояс
-Играть за Варлока
-Самый ценный лут давать тому, у кого руки прямее, например, если у вас (пояс берите себе, а так же + к макс ХП и ледяной меч-топор), прямые руки - это значит что в любом сражении вас атакуют 0 или 1-2 раза не больше!
-Другу стараемся выбить СВЯТОЙ МЕЧ (он длинный с крестом на рукоятке, светится когда демоны рядом, он как раз избавляет от проклятий, за одно и Duble Damage демонам наносит)
-Profit! )))
---

24741579.review:
Популярность жанра достаточно большая, но хороших игр не так уж и много, в частности, где можно играть с друзьями, да еще и на одном компе. Прекрасный рогалик, в который захочется играть часто. 

Куча разнообразных шмоток, эффектов [i](нужных и бесполезных)[/i], персонажей, ачивок (идем дальше), оружия, монстров, режимов [i](в том числе и сложности)[/i]... Ну, что еще нужно для хорошего времяпровождения? 

Сюжета, конечно, здесь вы не найдете - мочите всех подряд, открывайте сундуки, лутайте комнаты, подбирайте приколюхи... В конце каждой локации вас будет ждать босс, так что поначалу, чтобы привыкнуть к игре, придется чуть-чуть поумирать. Но и этот факт не всегда печалит, так как, играя с кем-то, можно будет восстановить умершего посредством сбора 10 душ, которые начнут падать с любого врага, как только кто-то из вас откинется; второй же персонаж, которому "посчастливилось" умереть, будет порхать в виде призрака, который так же может всех бить, но только сносить по 1му hp, так что толку от него мало, но он может скидывать врагов в ямы или удерживать их, так что...

Даже не могу сказать, чего не хватает игре - приятная графика, хорошая рисовка, интересный геймплей, куча разнообразия, от которого не скучаешь. Может быть только бы музыку подкрутить другую что ли, да и можно было бы увеличить игру, хотя есть одна фишка, допустим, если вы проходите игру на самом легком уровне, вы не увидите многих мобом, в том числе и боссов, возможно даже, локаций, так что играть и играть можно на каждом уровне сложности. 

Еще меня очень порадовали всякие бутыллочки, дающие разные эффекты - иногда вы можете выпить что-то и стать ослом.... или вместо головы у вас будет жoпа и вы будете издавать соответствующий звук этой части... Ну, все рассказывать не буду, так как достаточно много всяких штук.

Гарантирую, если у вас есть друг, с которым вы можете поиграть, то не прогадаете, потому что фана в игре достаточно. Да, может не хватает диалогов и сюжета, по истечению н-ного количества часов, но пока вы до этого дойдете, уже и неважно будет. 

[i]-Двумя руками За! подобные интерпретации, это я вам как любитель рогаликов говорю[/i]

24242135.review:
What happens when you mix 2D, comedy, Beat'em up with rogue-like elements AND online multiplayer ?  The best darn experience thats what.

[h1] Rampage Knights [/h1] 
This game is really entertaining, its a beat'em up game with hilarious elements and a fast battle style hacking and slashing through the enemies feels so satisfying.

You start the game at the "Town" where you can change difficulty, change character looks or add a hat, practice on harmless monsters, Change classes if you unlocked them, look at the current pending challenges which works like achievements, once a challenge is completed it gives a steam achievement and unlocks something new in the game, like a new mode or a new class or new skins/hats.

After you're done with all that you go right to start the first level, the thing about levels is that some of them locks doors when monsters popup so you have to kill all of them in order to proceed and some of them don't so you can simply run through enemies and avoid them.

most levels gives you a chest that you can lock it using a really cool picklocking method if you mess up you lose hp but you can retry until you either die like a noob or unlock it.

You get 4 slots, one for a spell, one for a throw-able item, one for a magic book, the last one for a potion.

There's a lot of spells in the game, lighting, fire, rain of arrows, teleport and way more, throwing items are either bombs or axes or daggers ..etc, books can have various effects, potions either heals you or gives a positive/negative effect.

The thing about negative effects in the game is that... they're super HILARIOUS, my favorite one is the chicken fever, you cannot fight until you lay an egg by pressing and holding the attack button ... I laugh so hard at this.

Movement is really easy, not clunky or annoying, controls are easy to understand, you can dodge roll to avoid attacks.

There's an endless mode that you need to unlock, the game has perma-death but if you play casual mode it becomes that if you die you restart at the beginning of the stage, instead of perma-death back to the town, also there's normal, hard and insane modes.

Runs are different since well its a roguelike, they get randomly created for you so you don't get bored quickly.

In Co-op mode, when you die you resurrect as a ghost, you are untouchable and can attack enemies to knock them over and assist your friend, which can revive you if your friend killed 10 enemies " the number changes sometimes" 

There are chasms so you can fall and die, there are traps everywhere, the game is really exciting.

[h1] Whats good [/h1]
+ Good music, sound effects
+ Animations, designs, levels.
+ Content, bosses, varieties.
+ Online co-op, being super smooth even though I have terrible connection "2mb".
+ challenges, different modes.

[h1] Whats not so good [/h1] 
- My friend and I finished the game a bit too quickly we felt ..a bit sad, it has replay-value but not as much as you'd hope.[b] Update [/b] Actually ? after we both tried to finish the game in hard and insane mode, trying to unlock all the classes and beating the challenges ? We're almost hitting the 20 hours time on steam and still finding more fun things to do in the game.

- You cannot disable friendly fire " You don't actually damage your friend but just knock them " So you'll sometimes knock your friend off a cliff by using a spell or a normal attack and get them kicked, strategy is to spread in level so you dont do it.


[h1] TL;DR [/h1]
if you have a friend thats willing to play this game with you, get the 2pack asap, this game is really funny and challenging and gives hours of fun, if you're both not into the idea of replay-value of rogue-likes you might not really be that hyped to replay after you finish it, but that might take hours to begin with, if you're an achiever this is perfect for you since it has so much to unlock.

Recommending this to all people who wants an adventure beat'em up rogulike game that supports 2 players locally or online.

게임 스토리 자체는 거의 없다시피 하고 게임의 분량 자체도 그다지 큰편은 아닙니다.

사실상 일반적인 로그라이크 게임 마냥 도전과제가 주요 컨텐츠 되겠습니다.

아이템의 종류도 생각보다 많은 편에 다양한 조합을 만들 수도 있고

도전과제를 따면서 게임 내의 요소가 언락되거나 캐릭터의 능력치가 올라가게끔 해서

이로 인해 적은 분량과 로그라이크의 특징적인 반복 플레이에 대한 거부감이

2인 플레이가 딱 맞다 싶을만큼의 구성과 재미를 느낄 수 있었습니다.

로그라이크나 캐슬크래셔 같은 액션 게임을 좋아하시는 분들에게 추천할 만한 게임이네요.

24037898.review:
[h1] Demons asked their master "But can we defeat the Alchemist with what we got?"  Warlock answered " Well I got rainbow arrmor, flaming mittens, ice boots and an axe. Well at least we gonna fail in style!" [/h1]

[b] Rampage Knights [/b] is a roguelike( permadeath machine) beat 'em game in which you start with nothing and lose everything upon death. As expected from Rake in Grass the game comes with a bunch of popular references. Apart from that the game offers 6 classes, unlocks and a lot of fun gear to use... if you find it.

[b] Combat [/b]

Being a permadeath machine , the combat will have major role in.... getting you killed over and over and over again. Combat is responsible for most time though I had cases of my character go skating while I was using Logitech f710 . Apart from that you have light/heavy/jump attack , combos and class based skills(or dodge). 
Worth noting is that you can throw/push or bait enemies into the endless pits  to save you some trouble.

[b] Classes [/b]

The game comes with 6 classes : Adventurer, Barbarian, Pirate, Warlock, Assassin and Battlemage.
Adventurer and Barbarian play similiar to each other(only difference is that barbarian is a bit slower and doesnt wear armor). Rest classes got its own playstyle so they able to keep the game interesting.

Your starting class is Adventurer and you unlock the other 5 classes by completing challenges(3 challenges per class). Now how much it takes to unlock them all it depends on RNG for some of the classes ( finding 10 books for the battlemage took me the longest).

[b] Gear [/b]

Now this is the beef of the game. If I recall correctly Hero Siege had the same gear mechanic before they went for the generic ARPG gearing up.

So what you have here is a bunch of random items you can pick and make a playstyle with what you find. You can equip armor , helm/mask , gloves , boots , weapon , pets and some other items that dont have defined slots. Apart from that you have consumables : skill(usually a spell that uses your mana), throwable(stones,bombs,knives and poison darts), scrolls and potions(game got some really shocking potions).

You find all the gear in locked chests(that doesnt stay locked if you have the right size boots). The lockpicking game is simple yet challenging at times. You have the lockpick moving left and right and you have to hit the 3 yellow locks. Do that twice( 2 sets of 3 yellow locks) and you got the loot! Dont worry if you fail. You can try again.. and again.. and again.. and woops now you have Treasure chest phobia... Better luck next time! Now dont worry, the phobia wont mean that you cant open chest, it means that when you try to unlock a chest, the lockpicking window will be shaky.

[b] Levels and Enemies [/b]

Levels in theme are pretty generic( forest, castle, catacombs)  but you may not pay much attention to them while getting pummeled by the chef in charge. You walk from room to room until you reach the gate to the next level. Room varies from the simple room with monsters to ambushes , vault , merchants or the Wheel of Misfortune(only once I got unluck and had to fight a lot of imps but ... lets just not talk about it).

 Now there isnt that much of a variety in enemies(attack pattern) but there is still something to learn while fighting against them.  There are also bosses that you encoutner every now and then(though its matter on how deep you get). Those are quite enjoyable to often you may find a cheesy tactic and defeat them with an ease.

[b] Difficulty [/b]

Now this for me is the most important part of a Permadeath machine and frankly.. the devs manage to make it fair.
So your starting difficulty is Normal - once you die you start from 0 , die 3 times and you will unlock casual.
Now dont dare to think that Casual means "Braindead stops here." Casual is more forgiving because its the only difficulty in which when you die you are spawned at the start of the level and not in the starting camp. 
Casual is still challenging in combat and its good to help you practice combat a bit more and complete the story once so you can unlock Endless Dungeon and Hard mode.
Difference between Normal, Hard and Insane is enemy numbers(spawns, hp, dmg) with Insane having the bonus of getting a curse or a disease at the start of every level with a slight addition of more traps.

[h1] Verdict [/h1] - [b] Enjoyable [/b]

[b] Rampage Knights [/b] is a well made beat 'em up that offers a good variety of playstyle and enemies to keep every playthrough(sacrifice) fresh. Combat is fluid and the gear you find is fun to use.


[h1] "... and then we found the Freedom Giver and started pooping bombs on all over our enemies ..."[/h1]

23824288.review:
Dank.

Solid roguelike beat 'em up like Streets of Rage meets Binding of Isaac. Also features a great co-op mode where you can murder each other "accidentally." (There's no direct damage but you can knock each other into enviromental items such as exploding barrels, bombs, spikes and pits will still do their full damage.) Lots of items, lots of unlockables, lots of small, permanent imrpovements unlocked through achievements along with different playable "characters" who give small flavorful boosts which aren't always 100% better than the starting characters.

Very solid for $6, great deal for 2 copies at $9.

23726934.review:
[b]Rampage Knight é um tipo de... Dark Souls 2D hahahaha
Um game estilo RogueLike com mapa gerado aleatoriamente e com alto nível de dificuldade, se você quiser jogar esse game de forma séria, e tentar passar até o final na dificuldade mais alta, você alem de suar frio vai precisar rolar muito no chão ehehehe[/b]

O game conta com uma arte bem bonita e uma mecânica de movimentos simples, mas nada perturbador.
O game conta com 6 classes, 4 dificuldades e 3 modos de jogo, mas sinceramente a classe de assassino e warlock são bem apelonas, o jogo é bem difícil, já falo isso de antemão, se você da rage fácil, não jogue esse game hahahaah.
Mas o mais interessante do jogo é você jogar coop com seus amigos, tanto online como em local, sair matando os monstros juntos é sempre mais divertido, o problema é que precisa dividir todos os itens que encontra pelo mapa com seu companheiro hahahaa
Falando em itens...
O jogo tem uma itenpool bem ampla até, com bastante itens diferenciados e cada um com seus efeitos únicos e exclusivos, e claro... todos são gerados aleatoriamente, você pode ter sorte de achar um dos itens mais fortes do game logo no inicio do game, ou pode acabar se dando mal e não achando nada que preste por muitas salas hahahaha
A campanha do game em si é bem curta, mas o problema é chegar até o final, a dificuldade é bem alta, mas para quem já domino o game, tem o modo endless que você pode jogar por hooooooooras...

[h1]Vamos as conclusões finais:[/h1]

[b]Pontos positivos:[/b]
[list]
[*]Arte bonita
[*]Jogo desafiador
[*]Itens e magias aleatórias
[*]Mapa gerado aleatoriamente
[*]Multiplayer super divertido
[*]Conquistas complicadas de pegar (isso também pode ser um ponto negativo)
[/list]

[b]Pontos negativos:[/b]
[list]
[*]Pode começar a ficar repetitivo para alguns jogadores
[*]Para jogadores menos "treinados" pode ser um pesadelo nas dificuldades mais altas
[*]As malditas CURSES! hahahah
[/list]

No final das contas recomendo muito o game, um ótimo Hack 'n Slash Roguelike por um preço interessante com muito conteúdo para várias horas de diversão!
RECOMENDADO!

23633604.review:
This is what a good solid Indie game should be- fun, easy to pick up, well-executed, performs well, and it has great replay value.

It's a game that's drawing heavily from Double Dragon, the classic arcade series.  Gameplay consists of smacking, kicking, throwing and generally causing mayhem in diverse levels that have all sorts of interesting obstacles and challenges.  

While I feel that the game would benefit from having a more diverse cast of fundamental weapons (there isn't the difference in game mechanics of Double Dragon's nunchuku vs. a bat, for example) the combat mechanics are solid and fun. 

What really makes it work, though, is the diversity of the special attacks.  While some of these could use some balance tweaks here and there (for example, there is a power-punch attack that works great but takes too long to charge up to be practical in a big fight, whereas the Lightning Rod is easy crowd-control fun) these mechanics make everything click well.  

I also wish there was a mechanic to return to the town and spend money on a new run; most times, a good run is pure RNG luck and there isn't much sense of long-term progression at the moment, other than unlocking Classes, which give a slightly different take on the core gameplay.

Replay value is excellent, and the short duration of the zones means that this is a great game for those of us with limited time budgets for video games.

23407687.review:
Pro's:
Great rogue like
Fun with friends
Lots of potions of varing usefulness.
Bosses are fun and unique (if not kind of repetitive).
Up to Insande mode (not including) is fun.
Endless is theoretically endless fun.
Lots of unique items, but not too many.

Cons:
No fun playing single player, it just feels like punishment.
Lots of useless potions.
Insane mode is just insanely unfair, we only beat it because we could endlessly jump so were glued to the ceiling.
Endless mode basically plays through hard then insane difficulty, then it starts taking your toys away around floor 28 so that you can't actually keep playing and eventually you will lose whatever it was that let you get this far and the health climb is rediculous along with bomb resistance.
Constant dodging is almost a necessity unless you can't, which shouldn't really be an option in one of these games and thats my only complaint about dodging really....
Feels like theres not enough bosses or weapons/items or a directory in game to show you the ones you have found and what they do...
Badly needs a DLC to increase the length of the game and the boss/monster variety (its about on par with the original flash version of The binding of Isaac.)

All and all its definitely fun, we got about 20 hours of gameplay out of it with experience in the rogue like genre and it reminded us a lot of other games like Rogue Legacy.

I'd pick this up if you can, its not that expensive but if it goes on sale pick up the two pack!

8.5/10 (would reset everything and start over again for funsies!)

23050896.review:
An excellent local and online co-op game, Rampage Knights scratches that itch to beat up your friends and enemies indiscriminately. Except your friend only dies if you knock them into a pit. Or under a strategically positioned Mighty Foot curse that smashes them into the ground. Or walk into your bomb. Or knocked down by your ghost after they killed you.

Regardless, the randomized dungeons, traps, curses, and loot add a perfect amount of variety to ensure at least a few fun run-throughs. The combat isn't just brainless button mashing, especially with its different mobs, bosses, and curses (hi, Mighty Foot!) out to get you. Oh, and of course, your friend on occasion.

With its silly, gory, and explodey panache, Rampage Knights is definitely worth the price tag on sale or not.

23033645.review:
Во время прохождения не перестал удивляться, насколько жестоко Rampage Knights обламывает новичков. Если принять за истину, что игры должны быть общедоступным развлечением и дарить приятные эмоции, то Rampage Knights -- это не игра в абсолютной стадии.

Rampage Knights зиждется на идеях The Binding of Isaac и всех dungeon crawlers в принципе. Ты входишь в подземелье и стремишься добраться до конца, превозмогая всех врагов -- ведь смерть здесь является жестоко разочаровывающим событием, откидывающим тебя к самому началу. Так вот Rampage Knights разочаровывала меня, как только могла.

Игра оказалась непроходима для меня на нормальном уровне сложности. Я провел где-то десять неудачных забегов, после чего решил отказаться от этой затеи, вспомнив про казуальную сложность. Rampage Knights карает жестоко и беспощадно. Выпив по ошибке зелье, извращающее управление, ничего не стоит свалиться в пропасть. Вместе с этим у меня есть претензии к разработчикам. 

Rampage Knights не дает достаточно инструментов и объяснений по поводу того, как выходить победителем в схватках с вражескими гигантами и массами соперников. Нет никакой гарантии, что атакуемый тобой враг не улучит момент и не контратакует. Остается только применять тактику "ударил -- отбежал". Толпы соперников нагибают только так -- не раз и не два находишь себя беспомощно валяющимся на земле, огребающим от массовки. За все прохождение мне так и не удалось придумать эффективного способа контроля толпы, оставалось только надеяться, что шкала здоровья переживет.

Вместе с тем Rampage Knights не особенно длинна. Существует большой простор для дополнений, которые увеличат количество уровней и секретов. Завершив прохождение на казуальном уровне сложности, я остался доволен финальным сражением -- понравилось резкое переключение жанровой стилистики. Побольше бы такого.

На данный момент это крайне разочаровывающая игра, у которой плохо получается убедить потратить на нее время. За приятной визуальной стилистикой, предметами, дарующими случайные характеристики, и достижениями ничего не стоит.

23022652.review:
"Rampage Knights is a cooperative beat'em up game mixed up with randomized dungeon crawling and exploration, which you can play alone or with a friend online" (Steam description). You will button mash the attack button on either the controller or keyboard, but you do have the other buttons that you will need to complete each run. This game is not easy to beat your first few times playing through. The difficulty modes are casual and Normal. There are two more modes that need to be unlocked, but they are Hard and Insane. You unlock features of the game but completing the in-game achievements. The selectable classes (adventurer, barbarian, pirate, assassin, warlock, and battlemage) can also be unlocked with the same system - except adventurer, you start out with that. Even though the levels feel a bit similar and the controller buttons are not bindable -- it is more of a minor gripe. 

It also has amazing pop-culture references. There is: Monty Python, Marvel and DC, Star Wars, etc., to be noticed as you fight toward the boss(es). Getting there is a task on its own, however, as this game is difficult. Maybe too difficult, but I still keep coming back for more. I must be a masochist. 

Rampage Knights is so much fun that I played for 5 hours straight without noticing on my first impressions. If you have beaten the game your first time through, I will forever question your skills - because you would have to cheat somehow.


Pros:
•Clever references.
•Online & local co-op.
•Permadeath!
•Randomized everything.
•Extremely humorous.

Cons:
•The levels feel similar.
•The controller's buttons are not bindable.   
•I die a lot.

22973243.review:
ローグライクのタグが付いていますが、ローグ要素はそんなに高くない。
往年のベルトスクロールアクションにランダム性を足したようなゲーム。

回復アイテムが本当に貴重で、ダメージをくらわないように戦うのが基本。ゴリ押しはまず無理かなと（難易度ノーマル）
ノーマルの下にカジュアルもあるので友人とワイワイしながらプレイするのにも向いていると思います。Coopはマジお奨めです！

実績とは別にチャレンジ項目があり、例えばある投擲アイテムで敵を10体倒せば以降投擲アイテムの攻撃力＋10％のパッシブスキルが取得できたりとモチベーションを上げてくれる要素もあります。

ゲーム自体は本当にシンプルな作りで、基本的な立ち回りが重要となります。
しかし装備依存な部分も若干あるのでそういう点では好みが分かれるかもしれません。
天地を喰らう２やエイリアンvsプレデターが好きな人はハマるでしょう。

良かった点
・操作性や当たり判定（理不尽と感じる部分が無い）こういうゲームでは一番大事
・グラフィックも味がって良いと思う
・フレンドとプレイすると楽しさ倍増（喰らい判定はあるがダメージは無いのでケンカにはならない多分）
・遊び心のあるしょうもないアイテム効果

悪かった点というより要望
・ステージ数は、あと1つか2つくらいあれば尚良かった
・ステージごとの特色をもっと出して欲しい（似たような景観が多い気がした）
・ラスボスが弱い（と言うよりラスボスに到達できるということは、自分が相当強いので相対的に弱くなるだけの事なんですが、そこも含めてもう少し強く設定しても良かったように思える。）

ここらへんはアプデに期待します。

クリア後にはエンドレスダンジョン等、やり込み要素もいくつかあります。

22861384.review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Roguelike brawler game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

You can play this game in fullscreen mode or windowed mode.
It has many resolution sizes.
You are able to change the music volume. (By 5% each time)
You are able to change hte sound volume. (By 5% each time)
You are able to play this game with a xbox controller.
You are ONLY able to change the controls for the keyboard and NOT for the xbox controller.
You are able to reset your progress.
You can play this local or online Co-op.


[h1]About the game.[/h1]

You are playing with a character and you have to beat up enemies in order to proceed. You are able to destroy some environment which could be rewarding. You are able to dodge and jump and do some combo moves. Monsters are able to drop some coins or health potions. You are able to unlock and play with different classes if you have completed some of the requires challenges. You are able to find some equipment and your character may look different. Some items has special effects on it. You have hitpoints and lives (depends on difficulty how many). You are able to find treasure chests aswell and you need to lockpick them. You have to hit the gold locks away, but hitting the spiked ones will hurt you.


Graphics are cartoonish but it's nicely done!
Background and scenery is very well done!
Music is decently good and has variation.
There is PERMA DEATH.
It could be a little bit repetitive because you are mainly doing the same move over and over. 
Game is alot of fun and entertaining.
There is pre-set character customization.
If you Continue your game, you will be teleported back on the exact same location where you have left.
There is a tutorial/training grounds.
You can play as a female or male warrior.
There is a difficulty settings and the higher it is the more punishing.
There are challenges that you are able to do.
You are able to unlock more characters with their own power.



[h1]Other things.[/h1]

The game is for mindless killing and doesn't require alot of concentrating.
Health potions will not disappear whenever you are entering a different room.

You are able to fall off.. from a room.. Getting Game Overs from that are always nice. Especially when your character is drunk and he really wants to fall off.. :(

Sometimes you are able to return to a previous room, even if you were fighting a few seconds ago. Monster's health will not reset or restored. It remains the same

-------------------

I Give this game a 9/10

22834992.review: I had a fun time with Rampage Knights, but certain issues are very frustrating with the randomness.  After playing through a few levels, I found myself with a mini-dragon that periodically shot fireballs over my shoulder.  My partner found himself with a curse in which explosive barrels fell from the sky and covered each room we entered.  So, as you can imagine, my dragon blew both of our characters up innumerable times after hitting these barrels with his mini-fireball.  Despite this, I had fun with the game, the wide variety of weapons and enemies and the feel of the gameplay.  I suppose receiving unfavorable curse/pet combinations may be par for the course for a game like this, but we spent a large chunk of time unable to cleanse my partner's barrel-dropping madness!

22001888.review:
两名刚刚去了趟地下城扛回一箱宝物准备回老家结婚（误）的骑士在回家路途夜间休息的时候发现宝箱被一个突然冒出邪恶法师抢跑了，不仅如此连反击的武器也被拿走了，于是俩骑士就毛了，要去邪恶法师的城堡干他。
这就是“暴虐”骑士的故事开场，虽然个人觉得“暴怒”更符合两个骑士此刻的心情。
剧情中骑士有两位的设定是恰好的，可以说这款游戏就是专门为coop打造的，如果失去Player2，游戏的乐趣也会直接失掉一半。

因为背景设定主角是骑士嘛，所以武器全都是近战。感觉是可以选副职业精通，但实际上主职业还是骑士这样。
即便有法师这样的职业，但也是要拿刀砍砍砍的，想远程biubiubiu过关的可以洗洗睡了。或者说这游戏就是推崇近战花式虐杀怪物还能回避自如全身而退。远程猥琐算什么，大刀片横扫才是男人的浪漫！
因为这样的核心设定，使得玩家攻击手段多种多样，什么破盾跳劈冲刺蓄力斩啊，还有践踏投掷挥尸体开无双之类的操作，打击感和操作手感极佳。
然而这游戏的难度真心比较高，就对操作的要求和敌人难度来说，和黑魂有一拼。这绝对不是一个可以随便打打就能愉快过关的游戏。（当然roguelike游戏普遍都难）
黑魂的战斗难度体现在精力条和血瓶资源的稀少下，这款游戏虽然没有精力条的设定，而且平均两个房间也会掉一瓶血药。但单论敌人难度而言不逊黑魂。
因为普通攻击在同时攻击多数怪物时不会出现硬直，也就是你不能指望站撸一切，而就算最基本的小怪也会丢投掷物，这也就代表着你时刻需要走位和躲闪，在高难度下甚至你每次的攻击行动都要算准空隙。
被怪物打一下还挺疼的，尤其在是如果你选择了血量比较低的职业，在高难度下真的可以说是一击毙命的程度，而且挨一下还不会停，很快就会有第二下第三下。
虽然翻滚等闪避动作没有精力条，这也不代表你一通乱滚就能规避掉所有攻击了。翻滚中的无敌判定只有几帧，所以在怪物面前瞎JB乱滚人家一棒还是能把你打翻。
就我而言，双人过HARD已经算是极限了，而在HARD难度的INSANE之后，还有一个更为恐怖的“影世界”。
在影世界中，每过一个场景，你身上的道具、职业都会变换，而且会加一个新的诅咒。顺便敌人血量更厚，攻击更高，我等手残真心只能仰望。
（最近刚刚开了无尽模式，据朋友说是更恐怖，连续5诅咒房间，或者进门发现叠了20层中毒之类的……太可怕了。

游戏中虽然没有友军伤害，但被队友的攻击打中也会产生硬直和击倒效果，这也就是在有悬崖的场景中要慎用跳劈的原因。你一劈下去或许队友就跟着怪物们一起魂飞西天了。
说到魂归西天，游戏中有个不错的设定。这令死亡的另一个玩家不会单纯地成为旁观者，能以另一种方式参与进游戏。
当一个队友死亡之后，他会变成一个攻击力固定为1的魂灵。这个时候他没有碰撞判定，而且攻击必会打出硬直+击退，可以做一些压制敌人的行动，让队友安心输出，或者将悬崖边上的敌人推下去。
当然，还可以故意惹毛大型怪让它一棍子抡到队友身上，也能在队友跳劈的时候一掌把他打翻在地，或者故意攻击爆炸物看队友被炸飞。
然而请注意这不是一个撕逼游戏，故意弄死队友或者勾心斗角搞得不能通关对大家都不好……

当然，roguelike游戏最重要的就是多种多样的道具设定，游戏中除了一些增加基础属性数值的道具以外，还有些能直接改变应对策略及玩法的道具。
比如拿到之后玩家就会永远朝向右侧的螃蟹，暴击伤害加几倍但是只有暴击的时候攻击才有效的剑，或者跳劈冲刺的时候会掉落炸弹的杖。
这些东西的存在会时刻令玩家感到为难，当然这也是所有roguelike游戏都会有的特征，玩家的每一次选择都成为临时策略的一部分。
当然，最后这个策略组合的如何，能不能强大到足够推翻BOSS，还是看玩家的人品和决断能力。（人品占大部分）

最后再说说对游戏中几个设计的看法吧。
首先是地图，因为这里的游戏场景是固定房间的随机组合，所以讲道理应该不会出现一些坑爹地形图。
然而游戏中这种坑爹地形图还真不少，甚至有之前一路顺风碰到坑爹地形就直接GG崩盘的情况。我个人感觉这些地图应该放在分支路线上，这样让玩家有一个选择的余地。
还有就是BOSS方面，BOSS难度水平差距太大，有的相当简单，而有的难到爆。（虽然总共就5只BOSS吧……（作为正式版游戏是不是太少了点
然后就是最终BOSS战，前两个形态都太简单了，完全没有前面对战小BOSS的策略性，贴脸平A就行。最后，估计每个玩过的玩家都会吐槽，BOSS最终阶段直接变成横版STG弹幕射击是怎么回事……游戏性质完全变了喂！

总而言之，暴虐骑士还算是个比较硬派的动作游戏，难度较高，对操作的要求和人品一样好。顺便，不建议单刷，找个小伙伴一起玩会（坑的）更开心。

21994517.review:
ショボいグラフィックに敬遠しつつも、やけに評価が高いので購入。
結論から言うととても満足してます。

◆総評
　いわゆるBinding of Issac系統のゲーム。
　それと最も大きく違う点は、各種様々なアクション（敵をつかんで投げ飛ばすなど）ができること。
　クラス制、難易度選択制など
　また、メタ成長要素として実績解除によるちょっとしたパワーアップがいろいろあります。
　ものにもよりますが、大体はちょっとうれしい程度。

◆なんで満足したのか
　正直に言うと、最初の１，２時間は難しすぎてクソゲーかと思っていましたが、
　少し慣れてきて、盾持ちの敵の処理方法や、ダメージを受けない立ち回り方、
　多彩な装備品（といってもぶっとんだものはそこまで多くない、とくにポーションは役立つものがかなり限定される）
　気づけば難易度ハードでも割と余裕をもってクリアできてくるあたりから、ハマってることに気づきました。
　アクション要素が強くなってるからか、Issacみたいに強力なアイテムを引いて、キタ！って感じが
　なお強く感じます。

　敵に攻撃を当てると大げさにひるんだり、効果音とかがかなり爽快感あるからかも？
　やってて楽しいしまたやりたい、と感じます。

◆こういう人にはお勧めできない
　難しいゲームです、これ。
　アクションゲームが得意、ないし慣れてる、好きという方以外にはお勧めできません。
　あと、日本語の攻略記事とか、ネット上での紹介記事はあまり見ない気がするので、
　Try&Errorしつつある程度自分で攻略法とかを考えられるのが前提です。
　あとは、何らかのゲームパッドがあったほうがいいかと。
　キーボードだと難易度も相まってやりづらいです。

21864602.review:
An enjoyable rogue-lite game. The wide variety of random loot drops, interesting enemy/boss types, randomized room sets  give it a large amount of replayability. 
The online co-op is a great deal of fun with friends, admittedly it can lead to frustration when your friend hits you with a bomb (which is the one thing that they can do to damage you) or interrupts you while unlocking a chest/playing cards with the devil/keeps knocking you down in the middle of a fight.
Even so the sheer silliness of the gameplay is fantastic, becoming a crab like creature followed by smaller crabs that only faces in one direction with a laser eye.
Having the Curse of Midas turning usable items into gold as well as a Golden Jaw that allows you to devour gold for health shows that some items have great synergy.
One of my biggest criticisms is that it doesn't give you enough information about items you pick up, it will tell you about the last thing you picked up but I haven't found a way to read over the entirety of my "Build" when I get multiple items in me.
Beyond that I think it's a great game and you should definitely consider picking it up for yourself and a friend~

21747553.review:
Прошёл на харде - имею право написать обзор. Сразу говорю, что палец вниз - не есть моё отрицательное отношение, просто система обзоров стима разрешает делить только на чёрное и белое. Ниже я попробую описать свои ощущения. А ты уже сам решишь, нужна ли она в твоей библиотеке?

Игра на первый взгляд действительно отличная! Рисовка - в один котёл добавили милую топорность и хорошее чувство юмора. Когда в первый раз проходил её на изи моде, я просто балдел от фантазии авторов. Но всего через полтара часа я победил конечного босса и пошла заставка, в бошке сразу мысль, близкая к фрустрации - ээ, и чё, всё что ли? То есть, слишком мало зрелищ для казуальщиков, одна пробежка без смертей занимает минут 50.

Да, в игре напихано много магический вещей, которые можно использовать, элексиров (как полезных, так и наоборот, делающих из тебя инвалида и только усложняющих процесс), оружие, в том числе и метательное, магазины, прикольные комнаты, питомцы, несколько классов, различные положительные/отрицательные эффекты, неплохое разнообразие боссов и мобов. Существует рандом в формировании уровней, местами, правда, он кажется сомнительным, потому что рандомны только айтемы и появляющиеся противники, макет комнат не меняется, они лишь немного чередуются. 

И вот после нескольких часов, ощущение такое, будто я видел всё. Скорее всего, так и есть. Потыкал сегодня немного инсейн-мод - не веселит, простая рутина. Наверное, ощущение рутинности у меня было уже после прохождения на нормале: почти все попадающиеся предметы использовал, мобов видел, приколы в необязательных комнатах - тоже, за все классы поиграл, игру прошёл, чё ещё надо-то? Ах да, ачивки не все, ну и что? Желание делать ачивки по типу разбить 200000 декораций отсутствует. Хард особо от нормала не отличается (инсейн, да - там много ограничений): что там, что там есть пермасмерть, а это уже очень ограничивает тебя и разгуляться негде, на остальные ограничения просто по фиг, всякие усиления мобов по сравнению с пермасмертью - пыль. Кроме того, даже с пермасмертью игра не особо трудна, не считаю себя хардкор-игроком, но игру проходил особо не парясь. 

Внезапно есть возможность играть вдвоём, которая может разбавить это всё. Но контента это в игру не добавит. Есть куча игр для друзей более наполненных увеселениями и, к сожалению, rampage knights им уступает.

Вот как-то так, к сожаления рекомендовать её по своим критериям хорошей игры ну никак не выходит. Но если ты готов потратить денег на игру со скудным количеством всякого добра, проходимую за час с небольшим на изи и потом после нескольких десятков попыток на уровне сложности с пермасмертью минут за 50 - валяй, бери. А так, хотелось бы пожелать разрабам создать игру попросторней. Например, на мой взгляд очень здорово зашла бы нелинейность уровней. Здесь же хорошо получилось, но мало!

21272126.review:
Rampage Knights is a game that I will buy for people so that they can play it co-op with me. It is assuredly a low budget, small-house kind of game but it takes those limitations and makes them charming in the kind of ways that we see from other developers that can manage a vision that fits their means.

Even at its most "unfair", which has to be when both players get the big foot curse, the game doesn't feel frustrating and in spite of its simple controls and relatively easy to learn systems, there is a lot to be learned about approaching situations and dealing with mixed groups of enemies.

The layouts and items are randomized a la binding of isaac and you can run into one of ... six? seven? bosses on your way through the main campaign. Deep down i'm always hoping for the magical run that gives me all my favorite items but you make do with what the game gives you. Or die and start again. Whatever.

This game was worth my twelve dollars. Absolutely.

A coop beat 'em up game where you play as a hero trying to break the curse of the forest. Fight through forests, dungeons and a castle to find loot, unlock classes and outfits.

[b]Pros[/b]

+fun with friends
+catchy music
+interesting Boss fights
+upgrades are refreshing
+tons of customizable character outfits

[b]Cons[/b]

- levels feel a bit too similar
- animations are rough
- story mode feels a bit short

Rampage Knights starts with a short cutscene involving two men sitting around a campfire. These two men are brave heroes back from their latest adventure! They're lost in a forest so they decide to rest until sunrise and set out again but before they can do that, a strange figure arises from the bonfire. It looks like the face of a person who wore the Majora's Mask if it took a toll on your health and sanity and horribly disfigured you. The figure is a Warlock who steals the heroes hard earned treasures and while the heroes try to fight back, the warlock subdues them easily. The heroes later wake up in the middle of a camp and that is where the game begins...

Once you're in control of the player, you soon realize that you're surrounded by many strangers who seem to have the abilities to help you in some way, except for Tim the Alchemist. He seems pointless with that cauldron of his. This is the central hub for the rest of the game, where you'll practice your moves, change classes, and change outfits. The only way out is through the forest, but the forest is full of monsters and only leads to a nearby castle, presumably where the warlock resides with your treasure.

Classes are unlocked through completing certain achievements during your runs, most likely related to the class in some way. There are 6 different classes to choose from and you only start with the very first class called Adventurer. Adventurer has no unique traits and is considered average in every way. Other classes will have unique abilities or traits such as the Barbarian who has more vitality and wields a Final Fantasy 7-esque longsword that has an insanely long reach but the downside is that a Barbarian cannot wear armour. The Pirate class has a peg leg, starts with a pet parrot that attacks enemies and regains health while drunk. Assassins can one-shot enemies lying on the ground and uses smokescreens to avoid attacks. Warlocks can summon demons and Battlemages can use multiple magic attacks and Teleportation.

Before you can set out, there's a short tutorial section to the left of where you begin. A notebook explains the mechanics of the game on screen in short and simple terms. X is to attack, you can chain combos depending on the way you move your thumbstick and the distance your enemy is before you. If an enemy is extremely close to you, you can push kick them which knocks them back and on to the ground. Once enemies are on the ground you can either pick them up or stomp on them for major damage. You can charge up your weapon for sweeping attacks, sweeps and aerial combos both break shields. There are also four item slots used for magic, throwable weapons, scrolls and potions. That's about all the basics to learn! Now you're armed with the knowledge to kick some monster tail.

Right at the entrance of the forest is a jester with the option of changing the difficulty setting. The default setting is Normal Mode, there are four difficulty settings ranging from Casual to Insane Mode. On Normal, permadeath is activated which means once you die you have to start over completely from the beginning of the game and losing all items and weapons. Casual Mode disables permadeath allowing you to restart at the last level you died if you're afraid of losing your progression. This allows even non roguelike fans to enjoy Rampage Knights as I know some players don't enjoy the aspect of starting over from nothing over and over again.

I feel that Rampage Knights plays best with a friend, while I played solo for a bit, it was when I coop'd online with a friend of mine that I truly felt like I was having a blast. The gameplay consists of moving room to room clearing out enemies that can range from a few skeleton warriors to mobs of demons and giant Orc minibosses. When you play solo, it can be easy to get flanked by hordes of enemies from every direction on higher difficulties. With another player at your side you can spread the aggro into a pincer style battle formation, making it much harder for enemies to get the jump on you. If one of you dies, the player becomes a ghost that can help stun enemies and can be revived by receiving a certain number of souls from killed enemies. Throughout the rooms you will find lots of treasure chests, these chests are unlocked using a minigame very similar to the lockpicking one in Elder Scrolls Oblivion where you push tumblers in a pattern except that if you fail it will do physical damage to your character.

These chests usually contain money which allows you to buy rare items from vendors but chances are they will also drop weapons like a generic battle axe or even the Mjolnir itself which shoots astral hammers. They can also drop rare items that can boost your attributes or give you special abilities. Monsters can also drop loot that may give you demon like powers such as familiars that can shoot giant laser beams or fire breath. This is where the game truly feels at it's best, the weapons you can find have so many different effects. You can find weird weapons that are weak but summon giant pillars that rain death on your enemies or even yourself if you're not careful. There are also Altars which contain magic orbs that will give you abilities that consume mana such as teleportation or chain lightning. Combine this with all the different armour slots and you get a huge variation of abilities and skills during each run that are drastically different. You can get cursed or diseased by drinking potions, making deals with devils, or even altar sacrifices which usually 'reward' you with perks of some kind like double jump, or permanent strength boost but the downside is that you may end up with an ass for a head or worse, every single inanimate object in every room is now an enemy you have to defeat.

Overall Rampage Knights is a fun beat em up game that is best played with a friend. With multiple difficulties it accommodates many different levels of players, even allowing pearmadeath to be disabled. With so many outfits to unlock you'll always be able to slay monsters in style. With so many different weapons and builds to experiment with, it's easy to do multiple runs and lose track of time. I highly recommend this to gamers who want a fun multiplayer or couch coop experience similar to Castle Crashers but with a lot more variety in weapons and loot.

20887872.review:
Rampage Knights is an excellent and polished game with plenty of humor, or references, to spare! The finest game from "Rake in Grass" yet! It is an excellent blend of beat 'em up and RPG!

Here's a summary of the Positives (+) and Negatives (-):

+ Tons of weapons, items, and abilities all on a randomized loot table. You'll never know what kind of combonation you'll get!

+ Nearly infinite replay value. All levels are randomized, and feature other sorts of surprises you won't experience twice in a row.

+ Fun and rewarding combat that is easy to get into, but hard to master.

+ Very challenging!

+ Colorful and detailed 2D visuals.

+ Great soundtrack!

+ Singleplayer or co-op, offline or on.

+ Achievements that actually matter! Earn them to gain greater strenth and cool passive bonuses. It can even unlock classes to play as.

+/- Not enough boss encounters. There are only TWO bosses... however, one of these bosses is on a randomization table, and you'll sometimes get a completely different boss!

- Animations and sprites are often copy/paste across multiple enemies.

- Jump attacks are too overpowered... in true Golden Axe fashion!

- Friendly fire is annoying in co-op games!

20884098.review:
Basically Every Game of Rampage Knights:

1) Start game at base camp.
2) Invite crazy Russian cousin to game.
3) Try to make our characters look like Mr. T.
4) Proceed to the first area outside of camp.
5) See grave stones and start to desecrate them for loot.
6) Find a potion in a grave that was just recently smashed.
7) Drink it without considering consequences.
8) Start fighting skeletons that appear out of the ground.
9) Mid fight, have the uncontrollable urge to lay an egg.
10) Mash attack to lay egg in the far corner so as to not be hit by anyone.
11) Cousin dies in process (and screams about Mother Russia).
12) Eat egg you just laid to gain life as skeletons approach you (cannibal!).
13) Kill skeletons and go to the next area.
14) Immediately get punted off of a cliff by an ogre. 
15) Respawn at base camp and make characters that look like Marge Simpson. 

100/10

20843816.review:
Rampage Knights is an awesome rogue-like dungeon crawler. You choose your class (bad: you can only play as one class in the beginning) and go into the dungeon. There you beat up monsters, find items and defeat the final boss - or die.

Though it may seem very hard to play at the start, as soon as you figured out some of the game mechanics it becomes really funny and easy to play. And even if you die 10 times in the first level - hell, it´s a roguelike game, what did you expect?

You make progression by completing challenges, for example dealing a certain amount of magical damage. By completing a challenge, you get a permanent boost for your character (like more magical damage), unlock a new character class, a higher difficulty etc. Simple and good.

Let´s move over to the cons now. It is very easy to die in this game, and playing coop will sure test your friendship for you can not damage your friends, but still send them up flying and stop their attacks. The hitboxes of enemies and yourself are pretty strange sometimes, but it is not that much to worry about. The only thing I really disliked was that after 16 hours in coop with my friend (I count myself and him as casual games), we unlocked about 80% of all unlockable content and are currently trying to beat the game on the highest difficulty. There are no new items or weapons anymore, we know them all. The only thing to do for us is to simply hope for the best drop luck - there is nothing new anymore.

To conclude, I say that if you like rogue-like games and don´t mind comic-styled graphics, this game is definetely worth a try. It lacks a bit of content, but you can still have your 20 or 25 hours fun with it. Go ahead and try. I really like it.

20781337.review:
Refunded it after an hour or so of game play... hated it.

It's a beat 'em up with really bad mechanics, poor controls and hit detection, difficulty is really unforgiving, even on normal mode. You have to die 4 times in order to unlock casual mode, which just makes you feel even worse about the fact that you can't even beat the game as the developers intended... but it's just terrible all around for look and design.

It's not your conventional Beat 'Em Up / RPG hybrid... The tags for this game are incredibly deceiving. You have two lives, if you lose them, you start over from scratch again... meaning, no conintues, your progress doesn't save either... You could find a new weapon, some trinkets, gold, etc... it all gets reset... it's completely ridiculous and stupid.

The Beat 'Em Up genre usually gave a character a way to continue from where they left off in limited quantities... So like 5 credits or whatever, and you re-start from the stage you lost all your lives on, which is fair because the game play was balanced. In this game the balance is tipped against you right from the beginning. The tutorial area of the game alone felt like it was somewhere near the middle of the game and that I should be using advanced techniques... they don't ease you in to the battle mechanics at all.

Beat 'em up's with RPG elements such as River City Ransom would allow you to keep your character progression even if you died 100 times. You would be penalized 50% of your holding cash if you died, which is a fair trade off considering you needed cash to upgrade your character and progress... so it forced you to grind to get stronger so you could progress if you lacked the skill.

In this game you lose EVERYTHING when you die... TWO  lives to beat the entire game, if you lose both lives, all holding cash is gone, all character equips are gone... completely insane, sorry I have a life and don't have aspergers syndrome, I don't have time for this garbage.

After this happened to me three times in a row after beating the opening tutorial area, I got fed up and got a refund... It's a stupid game with unfair mechanics, it looks like crap and plays like crap as well... 

The only appeal it had to me was the Beat 'Em Up and RPG tags, which is a complete bold faced lie because it only has SOME elements resembling that hybrid genre. It's not a conventional RPG / Beat 'Em Up game at all, it breaks all the rules in order to decieve the buyer, if this was the original developers intention for the game, news flash, you're doing it wrong... 

If you expect this game to be a conventional RPG / Beat 'Em Up game, then stay away as you will be highly disappointed... it's worth about 3 dollars at best and would be good as a novelty game if you got insanely bored and ran out of ideas to keep yourself busy... not worth the time.

20653363.review:
It's a testament to the replayability of this game that I've long since gotten all the achievements and still enjoy playing every day. There's enough randomness in the dungeons and in the strangers you'll play with online to keep it entertaining for a surprisingly long time. Plus, the combat, teamwork, and various items are fun to learn and (hopefully) master.
There's a fair diversity of randomly-chosen mid-game bosses, but I will say that I wish there was more than one final boss. He's not very difficult once you get used to him, which can make the fight with him boring and repetitive. My other gripe is that multiplayer is limited to 2-player co-op (either on a single computer or online), although it is executed very well.

I would love to see an expansion or sequel to this game!
10/10

20494131.review:
A neat little rogue-lite brawler.  Lots and lots of achievement-type challenges to accomplish as you play, which in turn unlock new things in the game such as customizable heads, additional damage, or changed properties of certain attacks.  Lots of weapons and items to experiment with, and a nice mix of enemy types to fight.  The online co-op really makes it shine, though it's quite a challenge staying out of your partner's way at times, since friendly fire (while not damaging) can interrupt your friend's attacks and movement, or knock them off cliffs and kill them.

It's short for a rogue-lite, but long for a brawler.  Expect a successful playthrough on Normal to run you about an hour or more.  Good in short bursts.  Also I liked that there's equally many appearance options for both male and female characters, with no gameplay differences between them.

刚开始玩这款游戏的时候，还没有成就系统，那个时候还只有一个boss，还有很多变态的道具搭配，慢慢的更新之后，平衡了许多，不断在更新就是好事。
战斗方式和以前小时候的三国战记很像，连招什么的也不难发，就是连招不够独特和华丽，操作难度还是有的，手残就要多练练了。有6个职业，每个职业有自己的特色和难度。地图和道具都是随机的，耐玩性得到了提高，再加上可以双人和解锁成就。
也是玩了50个小时了，单人模式一次我也没玩过，强烈推荐和好基友一起玩，联机非常方便，机关非常的恶心，不过欢乐，怪物非常的恶心，不过欢乐，诅咒非常的恶心，不过欢乐。道具包括武器，盔甲，腰带，鞋子，和被动道具，主动技能，药水，符纸。装备类道具只能穿一件，有的职业还有限制，比如海盗是假腿不能穿鞋子。
总之是个值得推荐的游戏，一定要和基友一起玩。
