- Fine for non-experienced in brawling. 
- You will die. Mostly falling off the cliff. Is it fair? It's up to you to decide.
- No lore or story of any kind. Just mindless time-waster. 
- No crazy item synergies. Very limited item pool in general.
- Boring bosses. Some of them crazy unfair and hard to kill, and some of them the exact opposite. Why? Because spending 25 min to meet slime king and die 3 times with a perfect build is part of the fun... probably?
- WTF with the final boss battle? Just.. why??
- Grinding for unlocks. Cheap tactics to increase total playtime.
- Costumes and hats, because it's better than actually meaningful items.
- Decent co-op.

But you can try this game anyway. It's fun and not that expensive. Worth trying.

17967667.review:
Le game-play est très bon ! On se fait vite au système de combat (que ce soit pour les combos ou les sors) les impacts sont bien rendus, les maps adaptées et les récompenses (vie / armes / or) bien dosées, en tout cas à mon gout.

Graphiquement le jeu est super sympa et plutôt original, une chose est sûre : c'est très vivant !

Cependant j'ai un énorme reproche à faire au jeu. Quand j'ai vu toutes les évaluations sur la difficulté, qui se veut être conséquente apparemment, et au vue de mes premiers essais (pas très fructueux...) je pensais que le jeu allait être un véritable challenge, qui me demanderai des heures et des heures d'acharnement. Finalement, en difficultée normale (seule disponible au début) et au bout de 4 heures de jeu (étalées) je l'ai fini. Il n'y que deux boss par run ! Le dernier étant toujours le même et étant presque plus facile à mes yeux que celui de mid-game. Bref le jeu est super COURT ! Une fois que vous avez compris le système et que vos loots sont pas mauvais, ben ça va tout seul.

Qui plus est, avec le recul, le jeu n'offre pas une grade diversité d'équipements ni de sorts.

Donc à mes yeux, le jeu est cher au vu de ce qu'il propose, surtout quand je le compare à un binding of isaac à la durée de vie bien plus longue et au panel d'upgrades bien plus varié.

En conclusion, je dirais que j'ai pris du plaisir à jouer, que j'ai été content de découvrir ce jeu mais que je suis clairement resté sur ma faim.

PS : pour ceux qui aiment refaire des runs en boucles et qui veulent s'attaquer à la diffulcuté "insane", là, oui c'est un véritable challenge, mais il n'y a plus le plaisir de la découverte des levels, des boss, des patern des mobs ect...

17964406.review:
This game, might be the greatest Rogue-Like I have ever played. I as of right now at 15 hours, have only beat the game on NORMAL difficulty. The game is far from over, there are multiple difficulties which juggles the game up some more, and even END-GAME content, called the Shadow World. There are six classes to choose from, my favorite is the Assassin because of the assasination ability as well as the double jump he gets right off the bat. Every single run in the game is different, none are alike, you will never know what you're going to run across, or who you are going to meet. You could meet the Devil and play cards with him, or meet a shopkeeper to spend your hard earned gold, or even a haunted tavern filled with ghosts. Every playthrough is fun and eventful, you don't even know what boss you should be prepared for as they are randomly chosen. This game can even be considered Castle Crashers 2.0 mixed with Rogue Legacy. I love this game so much and I can't wait to see what else the Devs will add.
__________
OVERALL PROs
__________
Co-op gameplay!
Colorful and neat graphics!
Tons of items to play with!
Lots of varied enemies!
Hard but rewarding gameplay!
Randomly generated everything!
Create your own character!
__________
OVERALL CONs
__________
Sound design could use some work (most enemies don't make a peep)
Pits and Spikes can be placed in very obscure impassable ways sometimes
Obvious glitches, but DEVs will remove them (one is somewhat annoying the most Teleporting Skill constantly killing me in a glitchy way)
----------
OVERALL       9/10 AMAZING GAME
----------
P.S. Fucking Wizards are dicks

17936435.review:
A fun beat 'em up with some modern gaming elements thrown in that make for a unique and enjoyable experience. 

The combat, while not overly complex, feels good and has just enough moves to make it interesting.  The controls are easy to grasp and feel tight enough that you'll be rolling around and dash attacking with wreckless abandon in no time.  And while the levels are linear (fitting with the beat 'em up genre), the randomized layout, enemies and loot help to keep it from becoming too repetitive too quickly.

While I don't think it has the sheer volume of special items that Binding of Isaac has, it does have a bit of that same feel with certain items altering your character's appearance and granting special abilities.  There is a nice mix of different weapons, items, potions and spells that can be found randomly that will keep you looking for more.

However, the game is surprisingly hard, at least initially, but not in an artificial way.  The game will generally give you warning when enemies are about to attack.  You really have to pay attention and know when to dodge or otherwise avoid being hit.  One lapse of concentration can also cause you to accidentally roll off a cliff or miss a jump and leave you falling to your death.  

Playing with a friend feels a bit like Magicka in that your partner can be your worst enemy at times when they accidentally knock you into a chasm.  Who am I kidding?  I was generally the one launching my partner to his death to the point where you would think I was playing with Jebediah Kerman.  Fortunately for me, my adventuring partner seemed to share Jeb's endless enthusiam for experiencing rapid unplanned disassembly.

I've only played the game for a few hours with a friend, but I can say that it was well worth the price of admission.  Being a fan of games like this going all the way back to River City Ransom on the NES, I may be a bit biased.  But I can already say laughs were had, tears were shed, victories were celebrated, losses were lamented.  And that makes for a worthy game in my book.

Which in binding of isaac terms that's like fighting the haunt on the first floor and getting Pageant Boy with only pennies as a return. 17933280.review:
Great Roguelike-game with many aspects resembling that of the Binding of Isaac, with the difficulty of Dark Souls (yeah I went there). There are six classes, five of which must be unlocked, and are all rather unique in set ups and play styles, all of which is not without its own pro's and con's (save for the Adventurer class). Playing co-op allows for some fun synergies and the ability to revive one another by killing a certain amount of enemies, making the pressure both intense and fun. Single player is also do-able as enemies are less in number and bosses with less health, alongside having two lives unlike co-op, plus the fact that items you find are all yours for the taking.

Pro's:
*Multiple levels of difficulty in a game where even the lower setting can kick your teeth in.

*Very Rogue-like being that items empower the way you play on top of a combat system that focuses on your ability to be aware of your surroundings.

*Random generation in all areas, yet each area has unique aspects that are retainned. 

*Replayability is very high; lots of achievements that makes you feel like a giddy 12-year old playing CoD for the first time.

*(Co-op only) Bosses are excellently designed so that dead players can revive (kind of a must-play to see the value in).

Meh~:
*Co-op is much more fun than singleplayer, but take of that what you will.

*The difficulty is extreme; every hit counts, may or may not appeal to most. (Perm-Death on all but lowest difficulty).

*Friendly-Fire when playing Co-op; does not do damage but annoyingly knocks one another around. Hard to avoid.

Cons:
*No true customization of characters; you're given a list of pre-made characters of males and females (though less female costumes).

*Items tend to be seen multiple times; you can actually get an item, find it again, and have it stack, though most of the time it's a weapon you've already passed on.

*Some runs can be very imbalanced due to room generation and the types of monsters spawning (example: you can play through an area with all little enemies, or meet a room with all giants, or even not find any worthwhile treasures at all.

*Hitboxes can be very annoying and frustrating; jumping well-over enemies to be hit anyway really sucks, the game is very roll oriented since most enemies that you ignore will spam you with projectiles.

*(Co-op only) HE. KEEPS. TAKING. MY. SH*T.

17919316.review:
Great little co-op roguelike brawler.  Online co-op works pretty well, with just a couple of lag spikes so far in my 4 hours of online play.  A few things could be tweaked in my opinion, such as not being able to knock your teammate over with friendly fire - they don't take damage, but they can be knocked over which can lead to bad things.  

This game is fairly challenging, but you will get better as you learn monster attack patterns and make use of ranged attacks, throwables, and the terrain.  Casual difficulty does not seem to really lower the actually difficulty, it just lets you restart the current level if you die versus starting at the beginning of the game.

There is some cheapness in the game which I wish would go away.  My friend in co-op says he cannot see the red circle that appears to tell you where the Mighty Foot will strike when I have the curse, so he has no good way of dodging it.  Having large monsters that can jump diagonally and strike so quickly is surprising...you can adapt to it, but their agility seems odd considering their size.  Minions that randomly strike the area around you should not attack exploding barrels - that just sucks.  Also when you have the magic carpet and the mighty foot curse, I think you should have the red circle overlay the carpet so you can tell when the foot will strike.

Also I feel the sound levels are too high in this game.  I have to turn sound to 5% and music to 0% to hear my friend over steam voice chat (and yes my receive volume in voice chat is cranked to max).

That sounds like a lot of complaints, but even in light of the 'cheap' difficulty, my friend and I are having a blast.  We bought the two pack on sale for $15 and will probably get a good 10+ hours out of it.  Not a bad deal.  The art style is enjoyable, there are lots of humorous moments, the random level elements and drops make each run unique, and there is a good balance of challenge versus fun.  It's not quite up to Castle Crashers, but it's a great time with a buddy.

17917365.review:
Take the rogue-like element of The Binding of Isaac, the combat and style of Golden Axe, add the humour of Castle Crashers and you get this wonderful game! 

For me, Rampage Knights ticks all the right boxes.

+ Very enjoyable combat. I really like swinging and throwing enemies around and stomping those nasty skeletons on their faces. Sometimes it is a little bit too easy to bash enemies into a pit, but it's a valid tactic I guess.
+ The thing I enjoyed most about BoI was the random item combinations you end up with. Rampage Knights has less items, but there are still a lot of interesting combinations to be made. In one playthrough I got a curse that summoned explosive barrels in every room; luckily I found an item that made me immune to explosions. I really enjoy it if a game allows you to use a seemingly negative effect (such as a curse) as a positive thing.
+ Nice bit of humour, silly animations, goofy characters.
+ The game can be difficult, but it is never really unfair. If you die, it's your own fault - you can do better next time and learn to avoid that damage.

The only downside I can think of is that there isn't any global progression over all your playthroughs. You can unlock some new classes, but that's it. A nice mechanic that a lot of rogue-likes (BoI, Rogue Legacy) have is that you slowly build up your progress every time you die, unlocking new stuff, which slightly increases your chance of a succesful run. Rampage Knights just puts you back to square one every time, but I guess it works for this game.

I finished the game in about 10 hours, but I definitely want to play this some more with a friend in local coop.
The developers also wrote on the forums that they will release more content for free later on.

17894454.review:
花了一晚上通关，稍微说说这个游戏。

这是一个类Roguelike式横版act，不管怎么说我还是觉得这tm比起arpg更像是一个act，死亡没有复活的话将会直接重来，手残慎玩。

随机的地图，怪物，道具，装备还有让人想哭的buff和debuff让这个游戏的耐玩度变得很高。

玩法大概是从一个版面杀到另一个版面，一步步探索到最后，简单粗暴，和以撒一样有很多奇妙的地图和奇妙的地形，打开宝箱要玩一个开锁小游戏而不是钥匙,这点舒服多了，起码不会看见宝箱开不了痛苦致死，只会开锁失败被机关扎死。

初始只有一个默认职业，随着成就完成会解锁更多职业，总共6个。

物理攻击有连斩，重击，冲刺斩，跳劈，踢腿，投技六种，还有翻滚躲避和对倒地敌人的压制攻击，部分职业有自己的一些特殊攻击和动作，比如说海盗能发射炮弹，刺客可以二段跳隐身刺杀。

物品有主动的，被动的，可使用的物品有消耗法力的魔法，投掷物品，卷轴，药水四种，前面3样基本上能用就用，药水有很多是有代价的，得看着点喝……

只有冲刺斩和跳斩能击破盾牌，否则对持盾怪物的伤害为0,怪物的种类也有很多，战斗还是相当多样化的的。

一次流程有2个boss，中间也许能遇到小boss，第一个boss是随机的，目前遇见的有3种吧……所有boss都是硬刚注定失败系列。
大概到通关的流程需要将近一个小时的时间但是这个游戏毕竟是roguelike，怎么可能让你轻轻松松通关呢，还是乖乖从死亡中吸取教训重来吧~

有合作模式，但是不能打路人局，只能邀请好友，不过我这种永远不打路人局的人完全无所谓，所有攻击对队友没有伤害但是会造成硬直，所以不能俩人叠在一起把怪日到死，而且我已经被机智的队友打下坑里摔死好几次了……多人模式只有一条命（单人初始2命有机会拿到多次生命，虽然多人也有复活道具不过很少），怪更多，更强，死亡之后会变成幽灵，可以补助压制敌人，队友杀死10个敌人之后可以复活，所以某些时候战术是很重要的。

最后，这居然是一个150m不到的游戏，是在下输了。

*HALLOWEEN UPDATE*
~~You know, I gotta hand it to the devs. I had stopped playing this game for a couple of weeks and the new update hit. Me and my friend jumped in to see what changed. There are a couple new enemies and alot of new items. Just that small halloween update made the game so fresh that we've almost beaten hard on every class now (from having only beaten it on one class). I'm amazed by how much life was breathed back into this game by just a small content update. These devs rock. You should buy this game on the spot.~ Stay spooky everyone ~


I love this game, it really scratches an itch that Castle Crashers left for me. But honestly, it plays alot better than Castle Crashers. It's got better combat, less "stun lock the enemy by standing still and attacking" and a large number of item drops to customize your character. There's alot of different head styles that also change your skin color and hats to go on top of them. My personal favorite combo so far is to play a Troll Barbarian with a Skull helm.

So far each run has felt very unique to me. 
The first run was me dying to silly mistakes like falling off a bridge.
Second run was actually learning how to play well.
Third run was unlocking the barbarian, I was also the ugliest face/hat combo I think I could have accidentally made.
My barbarian run was me slaughtering everything with brute strength, finding a flaming greatsword and learning a fireball spell that carried my unskilled butt long enough for me to feel like i've gotten good at the game.

Game plays very well with a controller. I think it's very well worth it's price tag, good handfull of classes that play very differently to replay through the game with. A pretty good string of unlockable difficulty modes, ONLINE/LOCAL CO-OP I havent played but I know will be amazing.

If you like the action beat em up style game, this game IS for you. The two pack is worth it.

EDIT: My favorite part of playing this game with a friend:
"Bring them up here so I can knock them into the pit"
*Instantly knocks me into the pit*
"Damnit Cory."

17886502.review:
Yep, 50+ hours on an indie brawler and it's still awesome.

It's a tough, but very fair, game. Damage you take is all down to skill and awareness. Items have benefits with drawbacks to match. Hitting a Wheel of Misfortune that gives both players Mighty Foot is a thing that happens, and it's a glorious time where you combine hysterical laughter with screams of terror until it kills you (or wins you the run).

Pick a friend, any friend. Buy the 2-pack or drag them in front of your computer. Use voice chat if you're online. Enjoy the hilarity of knocking each other into pits, spikes, fire, and giants. Get that cathartic relief when you finally manage to kill the final boss on Hard, then somehow beat everything in one shot on Insane.

It's worth every penny.

17884277.review:
Rampage Knights, é um Beat'em Up Roguelike, que teve um longo percurso até ser lançado oficialmente no Steam.

Essa pérola possuir cooperativo local e online para 2 jogadores, e aposta em sua dificuldade e imprevisibilidade para garantir a diversão.

A aventura começa no acampamento da floresta, onde você escolherá sua classe e personalizará o visual do seu personagem. O caminho da floresta até o confronto com o feiticeiro é composto por 7 fases sequenciais, que possuem layouts e conteúdos aleatórios. Passar por todas essas fases costuma levar cerca de uma hora.

A vertente de progressões permanentes no jogo tem como base os desafios, que podem ser conferidos ao interagir com o NPC Mighty Maximus.

Ao todo, são 80 desafios diferentes para serem completados. Alguns deles não tem nenhuma recompensa; outros dão pequenos bônus permanentes ao personagem, e outros ainda liberam acesso a classes, faces ou chapéis.

As classes poderão ser escolhidas no NPC Sir Bumperd, logo no começo do acampamento. Inicialmente, você só terá a classe Aventureiro liberada. Fazendo os desafios, poderá liberar as outras classes: Bárbaro, Pirata, Assassino, Feiticeiro e Mago de Batalha.

Além do seu visual ser um pouco afetado pela sua classe, o que mais mandará nisso inicialmente serão a face e o chapéu escolhidos.

Ao longo de sua aventura, você encontrará diversos itens de vários tipos: armas, consumíveis, equipáveis, etc. São mais de 70 armas, e mais de 100 outros tipos de itens. Tudo também bem criativo e diferente!

Outro recurso interessante do jogo é a presença de buffs e debuffs variados, ganhos das mais diversas formas. Muitos são temporários, e ai já há uma coisa única no jogo: um buff ou debuff temporário não durará uma quantidade de segundos ou algo assim, e sim quantidade de novas telas exploradas. Cada vez que você trocar de sala para uma sala nova, o contador diminuirá em um, até que se esgote e o buff desapareça.

Apesar da campanha ser curta, o jogo oferece diversas dificuldades para aumentar a rejogabilidade. A dificuldade padrão é a Normal, que já conta com morte permanente.

Se a parte roguelike não for interessante para você, o jogo oferece a dificuldade Casual, que faz com que ao morrer, você volte para o começo da fase ao invés de ter que recomeçar a aventura toda, e ainda fornece um bônus de vida.

Pra quem curtir o desafio do Normal, a ainda as dificuldades Hard, que deixará os inimigos mais poderosos, e Insane, que além de deixar os inimigos mais fortes ainda, reduzirá sua vida, aumentará o número de armadilhas e precipícios, e dará Maldições e Doenças aleatórias a cada fase.

Quem conseguir zerar no Insane, liberará acesso ao Shadow World: uma run totalmente aleatória e louca, onde seu herói é transformado a cada fase e recebete itens aleatórios, e pode enfrentar qualquer inimigo em qualquer lugar.

Por padrão, a movimentação é feita na setas do teclado, nas 4 direções, como em todo beat'em up clássico. O pulo é feito utilizando a tecla Espaço. Uma inovação é a inclusão da tecla de rolagem, Shift, que permite uma grande evasão e mobilidade em combate.

O jogo possui apenas um botão de ataque, por padrão a tecla D. Apertá-la em sequência fará o personagem fazer um pequeno combo.

Um ataque muito importante é o ataque aéreo, feito ao apertar o botão de ataque no meio do pulo. Esse ataque é capaz de quebrar a guarda do inimigo, e também capaz de quebrar escudos de inimigos.

Também existem inúmeros outros ataques que podem ser feitos segurando o botão de ataque, ou fazendo a sequência segurando o direcional para cima ou para baixo.

Você poderá carregar até 4 itens ativos, cada um de um tipo diferente. Você poderá selecionar cada tipo de item com as teclas 1 a 4, respectivamente.

Magias gastam mana quando utilizadas. Já Pergaminhos e Poções tem apenas um uso e sumirão ao serem utilizados. Armas de Arremesso também só possuem um uso, mas há a possibilidade de você carregar vários de um mesmo tipo.

Você encontrará diversos baús em sua jornada, e a grande maioria deles está trancado. Para iniciar o mini-game de lockpicking, basta se aproximar do baú e utilizar a tecla de interação, A.

O minigame é muito simples: você visualizará um ferro, que ficará indo para esquerda e direita, e deverá apertar o botão apenas para que pressione os pinos dourados.

Algumas das salas que você encontra nas fases são salas de evento. Cada evento é totalmente único e diferente, com potencial de premiar o jogador, e algumas vezes de penalizar também com algo ruim.

São cerca de 25 eventos totalmente diferentes que você pode encontrar.

O jogo limita muito a forma de recuperar vida em fases: ou será pegando comidas, que caem de inimigos e baús, ou utilizando poções.

E você também possui uma quantidade limitada de vidas. Caso perca todas, adeus run: game over! Isso só não ocorre na dificuldade casual.

As lutas com chefes merecem destaque. Em cada run, você encontrará um de três chefes no meio do jogo, e o chefão final é sempre o mesmo.

Cada chefe possui uma mecânica única, de modo que os encontros sejam muito divertidos de serem descobertos.

O design é bem cartunesco, com animações simples porém efeitos belos. O resultado final é um gráfico bem agradável e um estilo único.

A interface é pequena e bem posicionada no topo da tela, sem qualquer obstrução sobre o jogo.

A música do jogo é bem tranquila, nada excepcional mas combina bem com a atmosfera bem-humorada do jogo na maior parte do tempo.

Os sons são bons também, onde mesmo após um bom número de runs, não me senti enjoado deles - coisa que costuma acontecer facilmente em jogos do gênero.

Atualmente, Rampage Knights conta com suporte a cooperativo local e online para 2 jogadores. Infelizmente, há algumas restrições técnicas quanto ao modo online, o que pode ser desanimador para alguns jogadores.

Pra começar, não há lobby ou qualquer forma de matchmaking que te permita encontar novos jogadores ou visualizar partidas. Ou seja, você precisará adicionar a pessoa como amigo no Steam, para então poder convidá-la.

Não bastasse isso, nenhuma progressão permanente é gravada no modo online. Nem mesmo a run em andamento é salva, ou seja, se precisar sair do jogo, não dá pra retomá-la.

Os desenvolvedores reconhecem que atualmente o modo online é bem limitado, e já estudam uma forma de completá-lo com um sistema de matchmaking.

Já o cooperativo local funciona perfeitamente, com progressão permanente sendo salva sem qualquer problema - apenas não tem suporte a drop-in.

Em modo cooperativo, os jogadores só terão uma vida. Porém, o jogo conta com uma mecânica única: ao morrer, você vira um fantasma, e pode andar e atacar inimigos, causando 1 de dano e os derrubando.

O jogo informará uma quantidade de almas necessárias para reviver. Assim que seu aliado conseguir matar essa quantidade de inimigos, você reviverá. Também será revivido caso o aliado passe de fase.

Aqui é outro detalhe que pode não agradar a todo mundo. Assim como nos Beat'em Up clássicos, é possível acertar golpes em aliados. Não é possível causar dano diretamente no aliado, mas você pode derrubá-lo várias e várias vezes - inclusive em precipícios.

Rampage Knights é ideal para fãs de Beat'em Ups e Roguelikes, reunindo características de ambos os gêneros de forma criativa e divertida.

Apesar de possuir uma campanha curta, a variabilidade das fases, itens e inimigos, somados ao grande desafio vão manter o jogo interessante por bastante tempo.

O modo cooperativo só soma nisso tudo - apesar de atualmente ter algumas limitações no cooperativo online.

Análise completa em http://www.poepra2.com.br/analise/rampage-knights/

17882797.review:
If you love games like Double Dragon, Streets of Rage, Final Fight, etc., this game is for you. The game levels are randomized on each play through, and there are plenty of monsters, and other enemies in your way. 

Rampage Knights has plenty of random items to keep things fresh. Your characters have four equip slots for things you'll find on your way to the end. The slots are for Magic, projectiles, magic scrolls, and potions, one per type.

There is a lot of fun to be had with the fighting in this game. Although I wish there was a higher variation of attacks the characters can perform, I feel the developers made up for it by making sure that you'll die by your mistakes alone. 

There is a dodge button (which you should get used to fast!) and moves that can help even the playing field when you're surrounded. You're able to pick up enemies when they've fallen and throw them, and swing an enemy which effectively hurts any others nearby. An aerial combo can also be performed.

I have a good time playing this in single player, but its the co-op that makes this game shine. Your attacks hit your co-op buddy, but won't take health away from them. I had a pretty fun time communicating with the people I played with to make sure our flashy attacks wouldn't mess the other up in the process (No ones perfect, I admit I've kicked people into pitfalls to their death a few times).

There is local and online co-op offered, as of this moment you can only play with a Steam friend online. No server menu or matchmaking. I had no trouble with lag whatsoever, but the people I've played with live about an hour drive away from me tops. Your experience may differ.


All in all, I think this is a game well worth your money, especially if you have someone to play with. Give it a try!

17771733.review:
This game....

This has been one of my favorite indie games that has come out in a LONG time. 

It is a true roguelike, permadeath, grinding for additional characters/stats, painful as all help, yet rather forgiving. Most the times when you will die it will be at the hands of your coop partner, or you walking into something you shouldnt. There are multiple traps spread across the rooms, with a multitude of different triggers for them. Spikes may be permanently there, they may rise when you step on them, they may rise prior to you getting there and you walk on them after the fact.

There is a multitude of weapons, each with their good/bad perks. Also plenty of other gear to collect along the way. Its all RNG based, but the RNG is always amazing.

By far my biggest thing with this game, the Dev's are ON POINT. If you post any concern/question/feedback in the forums, I have not had that question go unanswered for more than a day. They are genuinly engaged to make sure this game is as polished as possible. I have given feedback that happened to be right before a patch was coming, and that feedback was fixed within 12hrs. In this day and age, Dev's like this are what seperate indie from mainstream. I'm still waiting for my Arkham Knight patch 2 months later, whereas here, if something is wrong its fixed nearly instantly. Bravo Dev's, I'm excited for launch of this, and absolutely will be stalking you on your future launches because I am ecstatic with what you are doing!

16924590.review:
在早先版本的时候买的，刚开始所有职业都能用，挺愉快的。感觉比较需要操作，需要一段时间熟悉操作。而且各个职业间的平衡还不是很完善。
更新之后，职业需要达成成就来解锁，可以选唯一一位女性角色，帽子好像也多了几个（不过一些需要解锁），还可以选择难度(就是需要达成成就来解锁)。成就系统让游戏的可玩性大大增加，也有了画时间在游戏上的理由。达成某些成就可以让游戏玩起来更加舒畅。
唯一特别不爽的就是卡，双人模式80%都在卡，单人模式打到较后的地图也会很卡，很容易因为卡而导致死亡然后从头再来（还好我之后基本都是“休闲难度”）。而且游戏有一些bug没有修正，有一次我能吃到金币却不加钱（应该药的不是负面效果）。
总体来说这款游戏很有潜力，可以先不急入手，推荐等到版本完善或是打折再入手。

16899188.review:
This game is an absolute diamond in the rough and i say in the rough as it is part of the early access program. The development team are on point with answering any questions related to the game and take on board any ideas the community throw at them. 

The core gameplay though basic (it is a 2D brawler afterall) is solid and extremely addictive and fun, with lots of classes, items, magics, weapons and armour and even a collection of hats! Did you hear me? HATS!

The asphetics of the game such as sound and graphics is great quality and fits the genre very well.

I dont really have much more to say other than i rate this game in its current state and 8/10 but when the game is produced to its full potential it could easily be a 9 - 9.5/10. I never give 10's because no game is perfect haha but this game for its genre is the best I've personally played since Castle Crashers. Also for its price tag you can not go wrong!

This is my first review so i hope i mentioned all key points we'd like to know when researching a game we'd be interested in. So go easy on me ha.

Overall Rating:
8/10

Imagine a sword that spews bombs, Eating gold for health and then whipping out a lightning rod to stun your foes. If that sounds fun and intriguing then you might wanna check out Rampage Knights. 
Bringing back the good old days of hack n' slash and beat 'em up style games. Rampage Knights is all about getting your hard earned loot back and decapitating everything in sight. Throw in some Roguelike elements. Curses, buffs, and all sorts of random treasure, rooms, and permadeath. This sounds like the makings of a fantastic game. With even more on the way. 
But wait! Don't go it alone and play this monster infested game with a friend in Co-op or Online Co-op! Even for an early access title everything works well and plays well. Giving you enough content for you to enjoy and see what kinda crazy character you will get by the end of the game. With bosses, classes, challenges. The game certainly gives you plenty to bite into. Any fan of the genre will be more then pleased by the old school style combat and the new flavor of modern games.

15611828.review:
[h1]Rampage Knights se joue seul mais prend plus d’intérêt à deux[/h1]

J’adore Rampage Knights et pourtant, je l’ai testé en accès anticipé.

Si vous n’aimez pas le sang dans un jeu, Rampage Knights n’est pas fait pour vous !

Si vous aimez les jeux de combat, vous allez adorer Rampage Knights. Surtout ce que j’ai aimé, c’est la possibilité de jouer à deux.

Vous commencez par choisir votre personnage (sa classe) et vous avez le choix entre l’aventurier, le barbare, le pirate et l’assassin.

Ensuite, vous pouvez personnaliser votre personnage. C’est très pratique surtout si vous jouez à deux et que les deux joueurs ont la même classe.

L’aventure peut alors commencer. Vous allez combattre des monstres, récupérer des trésors et des pièces d’or, crocheter des coffres, prendre les équipements  de meilleures qualités et absorber des litres de potions !

C’est un très bon que je recommande au prix plus que correct !

[url=www.graal.fr/2015/04/14/test-rampage-knights-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour lire l'ensemble de mes impressions sur Rampage Knights.[/url]

I also really like the cartoonish artstyle, and the character design and implimentation is great, and I'd love to see more combos(Perhaps versions of the skeletons on the last few levels that throw bombs, champion enemies that have different stipulations to them, ect). 

Obviously I've given a few of my own recommendations so far, but here are a few more

1. Alternate levels. I'd love to have an alternate castle(possibly more difficult) that appears every so often to explore, to give more variety. You could have repeat enemies and possibly new ones(Giant spiders, poison rats, ect). Also an alternate to the Enchanted Forest, perhaps a desert with mummies or something. Just a suggestion.

2. A reason to what we're doing. This is a minor one but I feel it could help the tone. Perhaps just a minor cutscene that explains what we're doing, similar to The Binding of Isaac or Rogue Legacy. It doesn't have to be anything complex, just a simple reason that gives us motivation. Perhaps its simply the treasure inside the castle, maybe theres a Giant beast that threatens the land if we don't get inside and take it out. Anything, really. Again, this is a minor thing on my mind, but it would help with the tone I feel.

3. I'm sure you guys are probably working on this, but I feel an overall progression system would help. I think thats what the strongman is for? I'm unsure since its not been implimented yet, but something that feels like your progressing overall and not just in how far you get in the game would be nice. Maybe a town we could build on? Just suggestions.

I'm sure you guys are working on more enemy variety, so that goes without saying. Nice work on the game so far! I'm glad you guys realize Early Access isn't for broken, buggy messes, but for games that have a solid foundation to add on. I think this game has the potential to be a hit.

-This EA review is more for the Developers, I've also posted it on the forum. As the game develops and is released I'll alter my review. If your mildy interested I'd recommend picking it up. Its not finished, but its a very great start-

Rampage Knights un juego donde veras tripas, cabezas, huesos y mucha sangre.
Unos caballeros le robaron delante de sus ojos el tesoro y tendrán que explorar dentro de bosques, calabozos y diferentes lugares en busca del tesoro.
Se enfrentaran a diferentes enemigos, desde esqueletos hasta gigantes, encontraran ítems que pondrán a su favor las batallas que se enfrenten.
Los calabozos son generados de manera aleatoria y podes jugar con un amigo online.
Encontraran muchos ítems con diferentes poderes mágicos y aparte diferentes armas con propiedades únicas.
Se puede cambiar de clase entre asesino, aventurero, bárbaro y pirata. También podemos cambiar la apariencia de nuestro personaje.
Abra trampas, vendedores, objetos, mini jefe y cuando este completo tendrá muchas más cosas.

[b][i]En mi opinión el juego es muy completo aunque le falta terminar pero es muy entretenido, tenemos diferentes clases de personajes, armamentos, equipaje como cinturones, zapatos, mascaras.
Los mapas se generan de manera aleatoria eso lo hace más entretenido y hay una variedad de enemigos que más interesante el juego.
A este juego le daría un 9/10 ya que es muy entretenido, bastante difícil, dependiendo de la suerte que tengan con los ítems que encuentres y las armas que puedas utilizar.
Una vez que este completo será muy entretenido y todo un desafío.[/i]

POSITIVO
+Mapas generados de manera aleatoria.
+Variedad de enemigos, armas, ítems.
+Poderes, Tiendas, Mini Juego de Carta.
+Cambio de apariencia y Clase.
+Cooperativo Online.
+Mascotas.
+Música entretenida.
+Forzar Cerradura de Cofre.
NEGATIVO
-No está completo pero una vez que lo este será un juego muy entretenido.
-Por ahora no encontré ningún error pero está en desarrollo todavía.[/b]

15169356.review:
You loved Castle Crashers? You couldn't get enough Binding of Isaac? Well, then here's just another game made for you!

Searched for a game a friend of mine and me could play together, and found just the game. It may not be something fancy, with lots of awesome looking particles and fx, but it's so charming in it's own way. A 2D brawler game that is actually quite challenging, since it has a rogue-like playstyle... and maybe some meanies in between.

The way of style is, may I say, quite lovely kept. Even though there is a lot of blood, whether it's your own because your friend keeps hitting you while you go for a sandwich, or more preferably the one of your enemies, it still has that little something that doesn't make it completly "senseless"-slaying looking.

And even though just running towards your enemy and bashing the shit out of them sounds quite exhausting and boring after a while; but just like me, you'll learn the hard way there is some tiny bit of strategy needed... and the will not to drink every potion that drops from chests. You might also fall into pits, get pushed near explosives that get blown up a second after, might get pushed by your ally, or knock him down by throwing enemies at him. Even your greed can literally kill you in this game.

You find gear along your way that increase your stats, or give you other benefits like immunity to explosions or poison, you'll find items that allow you to cast different spells, you can have throwable weapons, and of course pots. Gold drops from trash you can destroy to chests, with which you can buy some items here and there that should help you along your way.

It is challenging in it's own way, not only because just running ahead is not always the best solution, but also because, and that's a point many people might dislike, if you die, you are (kinda) dead. In Co-op, it is possible to get back to life, if your ally finishes off enough enemies while you annoy them being a ghost. But if you two are unfortunate, you will have to start from all over, losing all items and benefits. Same if playing solo.
*The developers have no intention to put in a save option, since they want to keep the rogue-like style to the game, since that is and was their intention when creating the game. They might add different difficulties for levels, and might even add one allowing you to save - but that's no 100% yet.*
So if you're not that kind of person, you'll probably have a hard time.
Even if dying and starting all over might want you to throw your controller away, still, you can't blame the game, and just keep playing anyway. Because it's fun!

What can I say, grab it, it's worth it. Make your friends buy it, play it with them, it's even more fun, and I'm quite sure you will spend more time in this game than you actually plan to.
Having spent some time reading up on what else the developers have in mind, I really can't wait for updates, and hope just the best for it.

15128775.review: This isn't your typical beat em up, it's beat em up/rouge-like dungeon crawler influenced by Golden Axe, Castle Crashers & Binding of Isaac. Everytime you pick your controller up and play this game you'll have a different experience. Mmost of the levels change randomly, the items and curses have different effects and there is no guarantee you'll get the same things in different gameplay sittings, then there are potions with different effects, different types of chests, alters, you even get to play a card game with the devil(at your own risk). Every time you play there is a different scenario and you can easily be forced into game changing positions at the blink of an eye. RK is very tough game, you'll die...trust me you'll die and die again....but the addictive nature of this game will make it hard for you to put your controller down, especially once you become better at the game. Once you know the right potions to pick up and the ones to throw away, once you learn how items works the games becomes easier, yet it's still very easy for the player to get his ass handed to him, AT ANY MOMENT, because of how random the game is. Even still, when he gets his ass handed to him he'll just want to dust himself off and try again.

15116991.review:
As of v0.6 (although I'm sure most of the points will remain true even after the game's released):
Rampage Knights is 2d brawler with some roguelike elements.
And what’s the most important part of the brawlers? Combat. It has to be fun and it has to be varied enough or you’ll get bored really quick.
Rampage Knights do not have a lot of combat variety in terms of possible actions - you can do 6 basic attacks: normal, jump attack, charged (and charged directional), uppercut and carousel. And that’s it. If it was just a plain brawler, that’d get boring very quick.
But Rampage Knights is not your simple brawler. First of all, it has crazy number of different pickups - from throwable weapons that do massive damage, but no always available, to a large variety of potions that can make stronger, curse you, turn your head into ass (I kid you not) or do all of that at once. How about some large foot curse that causes a large foot (pretty literal, yep) to stomp your location with a small delay every dozen of seconds? Can be a pain in ass, but can be damn useful too!
In addition to usable pickups you have different weapons and gear. Those are a bit more rare and you’ll usually have to fight a mini-boss to get them. But they as well can change the way the game plays quite a lot since all gear has special props, and weapons have attack arcs, speed and delays. You have to know how to use this stuff to survive.
Enemy variety is pretty decent - you usually have 2 to 5 types of enemies per specific level. It gets really hard when enemies start to combine with each other - getting those asshole archers behind knights with shield can be damn hard!
Levels are usually 5 to 10 randomly generated rooms (think Binding of Isaac rooms) made to murder you. Not that long, if you are good you can beat a level in ~5 mins or so. Again, according to devs the full campaign run should take about 45-50 mins. I wasn’t able to finish 3rd level, let alone the campaign - that stuff is quite hard :D
And all of that is accompanied by permadeath. Once you are dead, you have to start again from the very beginning. And you’ll go through the same levels, but with different rooms, different loot, different buffs and curses.
It’s pretty damn fun! And works equally good with keyboard and controller.

Downsides right now:
- No meta-progression, but according to description texts in camp - it’s definitely coming
- No local co-op (which would be perfect for this game)
- No proper resolution options, only fullscreen toggle (which might be problem for some setups I imagine)
- No way to rebind controller buttons (but that’s a minor one, default controller layout works pretty well)

You can watch a bit more in-depth look at the game here:
https://youtu.be/Rc6hV3ZHFlU

15107700.review:
Traveling home with a bag full of treasure from their latest adventure the heroes are set upon by an evil warlock, overpowered by his dark magic and waking up hours later they find everything gone. Time to seek out this demon to regain your loot and pride!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aO15XFxqKjI
Rampage Knights starts you in a village with access to several NPCs, some unavailable but the ones active gave appearance changes, alternate hats and choice of classes. Combinations ranged from wild-bearded vikings to leprechauns in space helmets (all visual changes only). Class options were Adventurer (no pros or cons), Barbarian (+strength, +HP, +better weapon -slower movement -no armour), Pirate(+parrot +bottle of rum +regen while drunk -no shoes) and Assassin (+faster movement +double jump +throwing weapons +assassinate finishing move -lower hp). There was also a challenge NPC (kill X quests) which didn't seem to be functional.

While the game is randomized you will move through select zones, each containing different enemies and alternate themes. Some areas you can make a beeline for the exit while others lock you in until completion of mini objectives or slaughtering everything onscreen. Enemy loot is gold primarily but also drop all manner of items (armour, weapons and 1-time use) so it's worth your while to be clearing rooms, including static structures which often surprise you with nice treasures.

Controls were playable and completely remappable with both gamepad or keyboard/mouse, but I would highly suggest a gamepad as it did feel much more natural. Game supports solo and co-op online play and while I didn't have a chance to test multiplayer yet, I'm sure it would only be more enjoyable. Soundtrack was upbeat and fitting though it could use a little more variety. Maybe I just didn't make it far enough yet. :)

If you enjoy things like Castle Crashers + Binding of Isaac and looking for a new fix, this is probably the game for you. With most of the content in place other then bosses, there is plenty to keep you going after "one more round".  Look forward to seeing future updates and easily recommended to fans of the genre or games I mentioned. Cheers.

I realy enjoy playing this game, solo or with a friend both is nice!

Falling into the void because i am drunken, poisend by an evil mashroom, pushed by a friend because he throws an enemy at me, pushed by a friend because he trolls me in ghost form, running into it because of a running curse or jumping into it due to a jumping curse has never been so much fun!

I forgot you can also fall to your death when you try to open a chest, fuck up, get damaged and fall into the void :P

But as soon as you get the freaking lifebelt you can yolo into that freaking voids as often as you want :P

Eventhough it is ea it's fun playing the game right now, there is enough content right now to keep you busy for some time.
Plus the Artstyle of the game is so good!

15105013.review: 这个游戏现在还是早期测试，很多功能还没开放（或是压根还没做），可玩性还不高，所以还不好评分，现在只能算是试玩体验。总的来说是一款类roguelike地牢闯关游戏，游戏画面很简洁细节做得比较出色，比如墙上的人像画人眼是一直盯着你的，吃掉的苹果会吐下啃剩的残渣等。现在还没做成长、任务、成就系统所以每次玩都是0级，地图流程不长大概只算做了一章，玩到最后突然就没了写句话到此结束呵呵。目前就3个职业可自由切换（怎么感觉不选职业反而更好用？），角色头像帽子也可自由更换。游戏打击感较出色，动作流畅，可自定义自己顺手的操作按键，熟练使用躲闪和蓄力冲击前期可以无伤过。游戏目前支持线上2人合作，但是只限好友之间联机。游戏目前只能算开发了一个雏形，很多东西都还只是在设想中，如果不太监，会是一款不错的游戏。

15083921.review:
If Castle Crashers and Binding of Isaac had a baby, it would look a lot like Rampage Knights. Combining side-scroller brawling mayhem with randomly generated dungeons which offer a myriad of ramdomly generated armor, weapons, and power-ups, Rampage Knights manages to still feel unique. 

As it stands now, playing multiplayer is a blast, and shows a lot of potential. I strongly recommend playing this game with an 360 controller, as it doesn't seem to be optimized for mouse and keyboard. If you've got a couple friends with which to play, I'd say Rampage Knights is worth checking out.

15080088.review: Игра отличная. Есть боссы. Также есть вещи над чем можно поугарать.  Графика приятная и можно разрушать много чего. я ставлю этой игре 9/10.

15079057.review:
Tough game, Very enjoyable to play, Great Music, a big bloody mess, The new upgraded Golden Axe Version 2.0!

Currently when you die, your death, no saving. So you have to start all over, with no progress saved at all. You can upgrade your char along the way, getting better gear and new abilities. As I understand, their plan is to keep the permadeath, but with some kind of progress. By doing different campaigns. I did see a list with achievments, but they currently don't work yet.

There are a few different classes, having different pro's and cons (think about health, running speed, damage) and different kind of abilities. Like the assassin can go into stealth mode for a short period of time and do a double jump. 

This game has a lot of promises. Can't wait to see this game finished, definitely a taker!
